metadata.comment: Hold rows for each date from 2017 - 2030

DAY_OF_WEEK.name: DAY_OF_WEEK
DAY_OF_WEEK.comment: number representing day of week for DATE_DAY where 1=Sunday

DAY_OF_WEEK_ISO.name: DAY_OF_WEEK_ISO
DAY_OF_WEEK_ISO.comment: number representing day of week for DATE_DAY where 1=Monday

DAY_OF_WEEK_NAME.name: DAY_OF_WEEK_NAME
DAY_OF_WEEK_NAME.comment: day of week name for DATE_DAY

DAY_OF_WEEK_NAME_SHORT.comment: day of week abbreviation for DATE_DAY

WEEK_START_DATE.name: WEEK_START_DATE
WEEK_START_DATE.comment: date representing the start of the week for DATE_DAY

WEEK_END_DATE.name: WEEK_END_DATE
WEEK_END_DATE.comment: date representing the end of the week for DATE_DAY

PRIOR_YEAR_WEEK_START_DATE.name: PRIOR_YEAR_WEEK_START_DATE
PRIOR_YEAR_WEEK_START_DATE.comment: date representing the start of the week for PRIOR_YEAR_DATE_DAY

PRIOR_YEAR_WEEK_END_DATE.name: PRIOR_YEAR_WEEK_END_DATE
PRIOR_YEAR_WEEK_END_DATE.comment: date representing the end of the week for PRIOR_YEAR_DATE_DAY

WEEK_OF_YEAR.name: WEEK_OF_YEAR
WEEK_OF_YEAR.comment: number representing the week of the year for DATE_DAY

ISO_WEEK_START_DATE.name: ISO_WEEK_START_DATE
ISO_WEEK_START_DATE.comment: ISO date representing the start of the week for DATE_DAY

ISO_WEEK_END_DATE.name: ISO_WEEK_END_DATE
ISO_WEEK_END_DATE.comment: ISO date representing the end of the week for DATE_DAY

PRIOR_YEAR_ISO_WEEK_START_DATE.name: PRIOR_YEAR_ISO_WEEK_START_DATE
PRIOR_YEAR_ISO_WEEK_START_DATE.comment: ISO date representing the start of the week for PRIOR_YEAR_DATE_DAY

PRIOR_YEAR_ISO_WEEK_END_DATE.name: PRIOR_YEAR_ISO_WEEK_END_DATE
PRIOR_YEAR_ISO_WEEK_END_DATE.comment: ISO date representing the end of the week for PRIOR_YEAR_DATE_DAY

ISO_WEEK_OF_YEAR.name: ISO_WEEK_OF_YEAR
ISO_WEEK_OF_YEAR.comment: number representing the ISO week of the year for DATE_DAY

PRIOR_YEAR_WEEK_OF_YEAR.name: PRIOR_YEAR_WEEK_OF_YEAR
PRIOR_YEAR_WEEK_OF_YEAR.comment: number representing the week of the year for PRIOR_YEAR_DATE_DAY

PRIOR_YEAR_ISO_WEEK_OF_YEAR.name: PRIOR_YEAR_ISO_WEEK_OF_YEAR
PRIOR_YEAR_ISO_WEEK_OF_YEAR.comment: number representing the ISO week of the year for PRIOR_YEAR_DATE_DAY

MONTH_OF_YEAR.name: MONTH_OF_YEAR
MONTH_OF_YEAR.comment: number representing the month of the year for DATE_DAY

MONTH_NAME.name: MONTH_NAME

MONTH_NAME_SHORT.name: MONTH_NAME_SHORT
MONTH_NAME_SHORT.comment: month of year abbreviation for DATE_DAY

MONTH_START_DATE.comment: first date of month for DATE_DAY

MONTH_END_DATE.name: MONTH_END_DATE
MONTH_END_DATE.comment: last date of month for DATE_DAY

PRIOR_YEAR_MONTH_START_DATE.name: PRIOR_YEAR_MONTH_START_DATE
PRIOR_YEAR_MONTH_START_DATE.comment: first date of month for PRIOR_YEAR_DATE_DAY

PRIOR_YEAR_MONTH_END_DATE.name: PRIOR_YEAR_MONTH_END_DATE
PRIOR_YEAR_MONTH_END_DATE.comment: last date of month for PRIOR_YEAR_DATE_DAY

QUARTER_START_DATE.comment: first date of quarter for DATE_DAY

QUARTER_END_DATE.name: QUARTER_END_DATE

ADDRESS.comment: The address of the contract or wallet the tag describes.

START_DATE.name: START_DATE
START_DATE.comment: Date the tag first applies. For tags that are permanent, this might be the date the address had its first behavior that warrants its tag, or the addresses' first transaction.

END_DATE.name: END_DATE
END_DATE.comment: Date the tag no longer applies (for tags that are permanent or currently active, end_date can be NULL).

TAG_CREATED_AT.name: TAG_CREATED_AT

ADDRESS.name: ADDRESS
ADDRESS.comment: Address on the blockchain

REWARD.name: REWARD
REWARD.comment: total paid through bounty program to the address from beginning of the data through the current date

HODL.name: HODL
HODL.comment: amount (of reward) that is still held in the original address paid

STAKE.name: STAKE
STAKE.comment: amount of the reward that was staked

CEX_DEPOSIT.name: CEX_DEPOSIT
CEX_DEPOSIT.comment: amount of the reward that was deposited to a centralized exchange

NFT_BUY.name: NFT_BUY
NFT_BUY.comment: amount of the reward that was used to purchase an NFT

DEX_SWAP.name: DEX_SWAP
DEX_SWAP.comment: amount of the reward that was swapped for another token on a decentralized exchange

BRIDGE.name: BRIDGE
BRIDGE.comment: amount of the reward that was deposited to a centralized exchange

FIRST_IS_BOUNTY.name: FIRST_IS_BOUNTY
FIRST_IS_BOUNTY.comment: indicates if the addresses' first receipt of the token was through a Flipside program

DID_HUNT.name: DID_HUNT
DID_HUNT.comment: indicates if the address participated in a scavenger hunt for this token

DID_NEW_USER.name: DID_NEW_USER
DID_NEW_USER.comment: indicates if the address participated in a new user bounty for this token

DID_BOUNTY.name: DID_BOUNTY
DID_BOUNTY.comment: indicates if the address participated in a bounty for this token (excluding new user bounties)

metadata.name: DIM_LABELS
metadata.comment: The labels table is a store of one-to-one address identifiers, or an address name. Labels are broken out into a "type" (such as cex, dex, dapp, games, etc.) and a "subtype" (ex: contract_deployer, hot_wallet, token_contract, etc.) in order to help classify each address name into similar groups. Our labels are sourced from many different places, but can primarily be grouped into two categories: automatic and manual. Automatic labels are continuously labeled based on certain criteria, such as a known contract deploying another contract, behavior based algorithms for finding deposit wallets, and consistent data pulls of custom protocol APIs. Manual labels are done periodically to find addresses that cannot be found programatically such as finding new protocol addresses, centralized exchange hot wallets, or trending addresses. Labels can also be added by our community by using our add-a-label tool (https://science.flipsidecrypto.xyz/add-a-label/) or on-chain with near (https://near.social/lord1.near/widget/Form) and are reviewed by our labels team. A label can be removed by our labels team if it is found to be incorrect or no longer relevant; this generally will only happen for mislabeled deposit wallets.

INSERT_DATE.name: INSERT_DATE
INSERT_DATE.comment: The date the label was inserted in the table

ADDRESS.name: ADDRESS
ADDRESS.comment: Address that the label is for. This is the field that should be used to join other tables with labels.

CREATOR.comment: The name of the creator of the label

LABEL_TYPE.comment: A high-level category describing the addresses main function or ownership

LABEL_SUBTYPE.name: LABEL_SUBTYPE
LABEL_SUBTYPE.comment: A sub-category nested within label type providing further detail

DIM_LABELS_ID.name: DIM_LABELS_ID
DIM_LABELS_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

metadata.name: DIM_EVM_EVENT_ABIS
metadata.comment: This table contains the individual event abis for each all contracts that we have ABIs for. Proxies are rolled up to their implementation.

BLOCKCHAIN.name: BLOCKCHAIN
BLOCKCHAIN.comment: The blockchain that the event abi is for.

PARENT_CONTRACT_ADDRESS.name: PARENT_CONTRACT_ADDRESS
PARENT_CONTRACT_ADDRESS.comment: The address of the contract that the event abi is for.

EVENT_NAME.name: EVENT_NAME
EVENT_NAME.comment: The name of the event.

SIMPLE_EVENT_NAME.name: SIMPLE_EVENT_NAME
SIMPLE_EVENT_NAME.comment: The name of the event along with its parameters.

EVENT_SIGNATURE.name: EVENT_SIGNATURE
EVENT_SIGNATURE.comment: The keccak256 signature of the simple event name. This can be used to filter for events in the logs table on topics[0].

START_BLOCK.name: START_BLOCK
START_BLOCK.comment: The block number of the creation of the contract containing the event. This could be from a proxy or an implementation.

END_BLOCK.name: END_BLOCK
END_BLOCK.comment: The block number before a similar event was created in the contract. This could be from a proxy or an implementation.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

DIM_EVM_EVENT_ABIS_ID.name: DIM_EVM_EVENT_ABIS_ID
DIM_EVM_EVENT_ABIS_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

metadata.name: FACT_BLOCKS
metadata.comment: Records of all blocks that have occurred on Axelar, Cosmos, and Osmosis.

BLOCK_ID.name: BLOCK_ID
BLOCK_ID.comment: The block height the block was recorded at.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block began.

CHAIN_ID.name: CHAIN_ID
CHAIN_ID.comment: The name and version of the blockchain. This column will deprecate in all tables except core.fact_blocks soon. Please modify your queries to join to the blocks table to use this field.

TX_COUNT.name: TX_COUNT
TX_COUNT.comment: The number of transactions that occurred during a block.

PROPOSER_ADDRESS.name: PROPOSER_ADDRESS

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_LIQUIDATIONS
metadata.comment: A comprehensive table that contains all blockchain and platform specific liquidations. This table contains liquidation events in which a borrower's collateral asset is liquidated across Arbitrum, Avalanche, Base, BSC, Gnosis, Ethereum, Optimism, and Polygon. Liquidations occur when a borrower's health factor goes below 1 due to their collateral value not properly covering their loan/debt value. This might happen when the collateral decreases in value or the borrowed debt increases in value against each other. This collateral vs loan value ratio is shown in the health factor. In a liquidation, up to 50% of a borrower's debt is repaid and that value + liquidation fee is taken from the collateral available, so after a liquidation the amount liquidated from one's debt is repaid.

PLATFORM.comment: The specific protocol where lending event occurred.

BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: The block number at which the transaction is finalized.

CONTRACT_ADDRESS.comment: The address interacted with for a given event.

PROTOCOL_MARKET.name: PROTOCOL_MARKET
PROTOCOL_MARKET.comment: The protocol's specific lending asset token, ie cWBTC or aETHUni.

LIQUIDATOR.name: LIQUIDATOR
LIQUIDATOR.comment: The address that initiated the liquidation call.

BORROWER.name: BORROWER
BORROWER.comment: Address that initiated the borrow event.

COLLATERAL_TOKEN.name: COLLATERAL_TOKEN
COLLATERAL_TOKEN.comment: The asset provided as collateral, which can be liquidated.

COLLATERAL_TOKEN_SYMBOL.name: COLLATERAL_TOKEN_SYMBOL
COLLATERAL_TOKEN_SYMBOL.comment: The symbol of the token associated with the lending action.

AMOUNT.name: AMOUNT
AMOUNT.comment: The decimal adjusted amount of tokens involved in the lending transaction, where available.

AMOUNT_USD.name: AMOUNT_USD
AMOUNT_USD.comment: The value of the tokens in USD at the time of the lending transaction, where available.

DEBT_TOKEN.name: DEBT_TOKEN
DEBT_TOKEN.comment: The debt asset, which the user borrowed.

DEBT_TOKEN_SYMBOL.name: DEBT_TOKEN_SYMBOL
DEBT_TOKEN_SYMBOL.comment: The symbol of the token associated with the lending action.

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_FLASHLOANS
metadata.comment: A comprehensive table that contains all blockchain and platform specific flashloans. This table contains deposit events across Arbitrum, Avalanche, Base, BSC, Gnosis, Ethereum, Optimism, and Polygon. Flash loans are a feature designed for developers, due to the technical knowledge required to execute one. Flash Loans allow you to borrow any available amount of assets without providing any collateral, as long as the liquidity is returned to the protocol within one block transaction.

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_DEPOSITS
metadata.comment: A comprehensive table that contains all blockchain and platform specific deposits. This table contains deposit eventss across Arbitrum, Avalanche, Base, BSC, Gnosis, Ethereum, Optimism, and Polygon. A user deposits their preferred asset and amount. After depositing, users earn passive income based on the market borrowing demand. Additionally, depositing allows users to borrow by using their deposited assets as a collateral. Any interest earned by depositing funds helps offset the interest rate accumulated by borrowing.

metadata.name: EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY
metadata.comment: A comprehensive convenience table holding blockchain and platform specific bridge activity from event_logs, traces and transfers, including bridge deposits/withdrawals and transfers in/out on the following blockchains: Arbitrum, Avalanche, Base, BSC, Gnosis, Ethereum, Optimism, Polygon, Solana, Aptos, Near, Flow and more. This table also includes prices and token symbols, where available. Note: source_address and destination_address are intentionally case-sensitive where applicable, depending on the requirements of the network.

BLOCKCHAIN.name: BLOCKCHAIN
BLOCKCHAIN.comment: Blockchain, Network, or Platform the token bridge activity is recorded on.

PLATFORM.name: PLATFORM
PLATFORM.comment: The platform or protocol from which the bridge transaction or event originates.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block was produced.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: Transaction hash is a unique identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed.

SOURCE_CHAIN.name: SOURCE_CHAIN
SOURCE_CHAIN.comment: The name of the blockchain network to which the assets are being bridged from.

DESTINATION_CHAIN.name: DESTINATION_CHAIN
DESTINATION_CHAIN.comment: The name of the blockchain network to which the assets are being bridged to.

BRIDGE_ADDRESS.name: BRIDGE_ADDRESS
BRIDGE_ADDRESS.comment: The address of the contract responsible for handling the bridge deposit or transfer. This contract mediates the transfer and ensures that assets are sent and received appropriately.

SOURCE_ADDRESS.name: SOURCE_ADDRESS
SOURCE_ADDRESS.comment: The address that initiated the bridge deposit or transfer. This address is the sender of the tokens/assets being bridged to the destination chain. This may be an EOA or contract address.

DESTINATION_ADDRESS.name: DESTINATION_ADDRESS
DESTINATION_ADDRESS.comment: The designated address set to receive the bridged tokens on the target chain after the completion of the bridge transaction. For non-evm chains, the hex address is decoded/encoded to match the data format of the destination chain, where possible. This may be an EOA or contract address.

DIRECTION.name: DIRECTION
DIRECTION.comment: Indicates the direction in which the assets are being bridged, out/outbound or in/inbound.

TOKEN_ADDRESS.name: TOKEN_ADDRESS
TOKEN_ADDRESS.comment: The address associated with the token that is being bridged. It provides a unique identifier for the token within its origin blockchain.

TOKEN_SYMBOL.name: TOKEN_SYMBOL
TOKEN_SYMBOL.comment: The symbol representing the token being bridged. This provides a shorthand representation of the token.

AMOUNT_RAW.name: AMOUNT_RAW
AMOUNT_RAW.comment: The raw, non-decimal adjusted amount of tokens involved in the bridge transaction. For Solana, these are decimal adjusted amounts.

AMOUNT.name: AMOUNT
AMOUNT.comment: The decimal adjusted amount of tokens involved in the bridge transaction, where available.

AMOUNT_USD.name: AMOUNT_USD
AMOUNT_USD.comment: The value of the bridged tokens in USD at the time of the bridge transaction, where available.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID.name: EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID
EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

metadata.name: FACT_DEX_SWAPS
metadata.comment: A comprehensive fact table holding blockchain and platform specific decentralized exchange swaps. This table contains dex swaps from Arbitrum, Avalanche, Base, BSC, Gnosis, Ethereum, Optimism, Polygon, Osmosis, Solana, and Near.

BLOCKCHAIN.name: BLOCKCHAIN
BLOCKCHAIN.comment: Blockchain, Network, or Platform the token price is recorded on.

PLATFORM.name: PLATFORM
PLATFORM.comment: The name of the dex or swap platform

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block was produced.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: Transaction hash is a unique identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed.

CONTRACT_ADDRESS.name: CONTRACT_ADDRESS
CONTRACT_ADDRESS.comment: The contract address interacted with for the swap, typically the liquidity pool or router address, where applicable. Value may be NULL for certain chains, such as Osmosis and Near, where records occur at a different granularity such as one row per transaction rather than one row per event.

TRADER.name: TRADER
TRADER.comment: The address that initiated the swap.

TOKEN_IN.name: TOKEN_IN
TOKEN_IN.comment: The address of the token sent for swap.

AMOUNT_IN_RAW.name: AMOUNT_IN_RAW
AMOUNT_IN_RAW.comment: The unadjusted amount of tokens put into the swap.

TOKEN_OUT.name: TOKEN_OUT
TOKEN_OUT.comment: The address of the token being swapped to.

AMOUNT_OUT_RAW.name: AMOUNT_OUT_RAW
AMOUNT_OUT_RAW.comment: The unadjusted amount of tokens taken out of or received from the swap.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

FACT_DEX_SWAPS_ID.name: FACT_DEX_SWAPS_ID
FACT_DEX_SWAPS_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

metadata.name: FACT_VALIDATORS
metadata.comment: Contains validator metadata for Axelar, Cosmos, and Osmosis.

ADDRESS.name: ADDRESS
ADDRESS.comment: Address unique to an individual wallet, validator, or token.

CREATOR.name: CREATOR
CREATOR.comment: Name of the label creator - for now, this will always be "Flipside."

LABEL_TYPE.name: LABEL_TYPE
LABEL_TYPE.comment: A broad category that describes what a label is representing.

LABEL_SUBTYPE.name: LABEL_SUBTYPE
LABEL_SUBTYPE.comment: Adds more detail to the label type.

LABEL.name: LABEL
LABEL.comment: The label or name of the address.

PROJECT_NAME.name: PROJECT_NAME
PROJECT_NAME.comment: The name of the project the label belongs to.

ACCOUNT_ADDRESS.name: ACCOUNT_ADDRESS
ACCOUNT_ADDRESS.comment: The osmosis address of the user / entity that operates the validator.

DELEGATOR_SHARES.name: DELEGATOR_SHARES
DELEGATOR_SHARES.comment: The number of tokens staked to the validator.

JAILED.name: JAILED
JAILED.comment: FALSE when a validator is not jailed, TRUE when a validator is jailed

MAX_CHANGE_RATE.name: MAX_CHANGE_RATE
MAX_CHANGE_RATE.comment: The maximum rate at which a validator can change their commission per day.

MAX_RATE.name: MAX_RATE
MAX_RATE.comment: The maximum commission rate that the validator can charge

MIN_SELF_DELEGATION.name: MIN_SELF_DELEGATION
MIN_SELF_DELEGATION.comment: The minimum number of OSMO tokens that the operator must be staking with their own validator

RANK.name: RANK
RANK.comment: The rank of the validator in the validator set. Rank is determined by the number of OSMO tokens staked to the validator

MISSED_BLOCKS.name: MISSED_BLOCKS
MISSED_BLOCKS.comment: The number of blocks the validator has been down for during it's lifetime.

RAW_METADATA.name: RAW_METADATA
RAW_METADATA.comment: Additional details about the validator or token in json format.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

FACT_VALIDATORS_ID.name: FACT_VALIDATORS_ID
FACT_VALIDATORS_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_REPAYMENTS
metadata.comment: A comprehensive table that contains events in which a borrower repays their loan (debt) across Arbitrum, Avalanche, Base, BSC, Gnosis, Ethereum, Optimism, and Polygon. Loans are repaid in the same asset borrowed, plus accrued interest. Borrowers can pay back their loan based on the USD price as they can borrow any of the available stable coins (USDC, DAI, USDT, etc.).

PLATFORM.name: PLATFORM
PLATFORM.comment: The specific protocol where lending event occurred.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: The block number at which the transaction is finalized.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The block timestamp of this transaction in UTC

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed.

CONTRACT_ADDRESS.name: CONTRACT_ADDRESS
CONTRACT_ADDRESS.comment: The address interacted with for a given event.

PROTOCOL_MARKET.name: PROTOCOL_MARKET
PROTOCOL_MARKET.comment: The protocol's specific lending asset token, ie cWBTC or aETHUni.

PAYER.name: PAYER
PAYER.comment: The address that initiated the repayment.

BORROWER.name: BORROWER
BORROWER.comment: Address that initiated the borrow event.

TOKEN_ADDRESS.name: TOKEN_ADDRESS
TOKEN_ADDRESS.comment: The address of the token associated with the lending action.

TOKEN_SYMBOL.name: TOKEN_SYMBOL
TOKEN_SYMBOL.comment: The symbol of the token associated with the lending action.

AMOUNT.name: AMOUNT
AMOUNT.comment: The decimal adjusted amount of tokens involved in the lending transaction, where available.

AMOUNT_USD.name: AMOUNT_USD
AMOUNT_USD.comment: The value of the tokens in USD at the time of the lending transaction, where available.

EZ_LENDING_REPAYMENTS_ID.name: EZ_LENDING_REPAYMENTS_ID
EZ_LENDING_REPAYMENTS_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

metadata.name: EZ_PRICES_HOURLY
metadata.comment: A convenience table for determining token prices by address and blockchain, and native asset prices by symbol and blockchain. This data set is highly curated and contains metadata for one price per hour per unique asset and blockchain.

HOUR.name: HOUR
HOUR.comment: Hour that the price was recorded at.

TOKEN_ADDRESS.name: TOKEN_ADDRESS
TOKEN_ADDRESS.comment: The specific address representing the asset on a specific platform. This will be NULL if referring to a native asset.

DECIMALS.name: DECIMALS
DECIMALS.comment: The number of decimals for the asset. May be NULL.

PRICE.name: PRICE
PRICE.comment: Closing price of the recorded hour in USD.

BLOCKCHAIN.name: BLOCKCHAIN
BLOCKCHAIN.comment: The Blockchain, Network, or Platform for this asset.

IS_NATIVE.name: IS_NATIVE
IS_NATIVE.comment: A flag indicating assets native to the respective blockchain.

IS_IMPUTED.name: IS_IMPUTED
IS_IMPUTED.comment: A flag indicating if the price was imputed, or derived, from the last arriving record. This is generally used for tokens with low-liquidity or inconsistent reporting.

IS_DEPRECATED.name: IS_DEPRECATED
IS_DEPRECATED.comment: A flag indicating if the asset is deprecated or no longer supported by the provider.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP

metadata.name: EZ_ENS_DOMAINS
metadata.comment: A convenience table with up-to-date details pertaining to ENS domains registered onchain. Note, records are derived directly from on-chain event logs only and may not be inclusive of off-chain activity.

LAST_REGISTERED_BLOCK.name: LAST_REGISTERED_BLOCK
LAST_REGISTERED_BLOCK.comment: The latest block number in which the domain was registered.

LAST_REGISTERED_TIMESTAMP.name: LAST_REGISTERED_TIMESTAMP
LAST_REGISTERED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The timestamp corresponding to the latest block in which the domain was registered.

LAST_REGISTERED_TX_HASH.name: LAST_REGISTERED_TX_HASH
LAST_REGISTERED_TX_HASH.comment: Transaction hash of the most recent domain registration event.

LAST_REGISTERED_CONTRACT.name: LAST_REGISTERED_CONTRACT
LAST_REGISTERED_CONTRACT.comment: The contract address responsible for the most recent domain registration.

MANAGER.name: MANAGER
MANAGER.comment: The address that currently manages the domain.

OWNER.name: OWNER
OWNER.comment: The address that currently owns the domain.

SET_ADDRESS.name: SET_ADDRESS
SET_ADDRESS.comment: The address that the domain currently resolves to.

ENS_SET.name: ENS_SET
ENS_SET.comment: Indicates if the domain has been set to an address.

ENS_SUBDOMAINS.name: ENS_SUBDOMAINS
ENS_SUBDOMAINS.comment: Any subdomains that are associated with the primary domain.

LABEL.name: LABEL
LABEL.comment: The label hash, which is a representation of the domain.

NODE.name: NODE
NODE.comment: A hash representing the ENS domain.

TOKEN_ID.name: TOKEN_ID
TOKEN_ID.comment: The ID of the token associated with the domain.

LAST_REGISTERED_COST.name: LAST_REGISTERED_COST
LAST_REGISTERED_COST.comment: The cost associated with the most recent registration of the domain.

LAST_REGISTERED_PREMIUM.name: LAST_REGISTERED_PREMIUM
LAST_REGISTERED_PREMIUM.comment: Any additional premium paid during the most recent registration of the domain.

RENEWAL_COST.name: RENEWAL_COST
RENEWAL_COST.comment: The cost to renew the domain's registration.

EXPIRATION_TIMESTAMP.name: EXPIRATION_TIMESTAMP
EXPIRATION_TIMESTAMP.comment: The timestamp at which the domain registration will expire.

EXPIRED.name: EXPIRED
EXPIRED.comment: Indicates if the domain registration has expired.

RESOLVER.name: RESOLVER
RESOLVER.comment: The address of the resolver contract that provides records for the domain.

PROFILE.name: PROFILE
PROFILE.comment: Profile information, such as avatars or social links, associated with the domain.

LAST_UPDATED.name: LAST_UPDATED
LAST_UPDATED.comment: The timestamp of the last update made to the domain's record or last updated record in this table.

EZ_ENS_DOMAINS_ID.name: EZ_ENS_DOMAINS_ID
EZ_ENS_DOMAINS_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH

metadata.name: FACT_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY
metadata.comment: A comprehensive fact table holding blockchain and platform specific bridge activity from event_logs, traces and transfers, including bridge deposits/withdrawals and transfers in/out on the following blockchains: Arbitrum, Avalanche, Base, BSC, Gnosis, Ethereum, Optimism, Polygon, and Solana.

BLOCKCHAIN.name: BLOCKCHAIN
BLOCKCHAIN.comment: Blockchain, Network, or Platform the token bridge activity is recorded on.

PLATFORM.name: PLATFORM
PLATFORM.comment: The platform or protocol from which the bridge transaction or event originates.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block was produced.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: Transaction hash is a unique identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed.

SOURCE_CHAIN.name: SOURCE_CHAIN
SOURCE_CHAIN.comment: The name of the blockchain network to which the assets are being bridged from.

DESTINATION_CHAIN.name: DESTINATION_CHAIN
DESTINATION_CHAIN.comment: The name of the blockchain network to which the assets are being bridged to.

BRIDGE_ADDRESS.name: BRIDGE_ADDRESS
BRIDGE_ADDRESS.comment: The address of the contract responsible for handling the bridge deposit or transfer. This contract mediates the transfer and ensures that assets are sent and received appropriately.

SOURCE_ADDRESS.name: SOURCE_ADDRESS
SOURCE_ADDRESS.comment: The address that initiated the bridge deposit or transfer. This address is the sender of the tokens/assets being bridged to the destination chain. This may be an EOA or contract address.

DESTINATION_ADDRESS.name: DESTINATION_ADDRESS
DESTINATION_ADDRESS.comment: The designated address set to receive the bridged tokens on the target chain after the completion of the bridge transaction. For non-evm chains, the hex address is decoded/encoded to match the data format of the destination chain, where possible. This may be an EOA or contract address.

DIRECTION.name: DIRECTION
DIRECTION.comment: Indicates the direction in which the assets are being bridged, out/outbound or in/inbound.

TOKEN_ADDRESS.name: TOKEN_ADDRESS
TOKEN_ADDRESS.comment: The address associated with the token that is being bridged. It provides a unique identifier for the token within its origin blockchain.

AMOUNT_RAW.name: AMOUNT_RAW
AMOUNT_RAW.comment: The raw, non-decimal adjusted amount of tokens involved in the bridge transaction. For Solana, these are decimal adjusted amounts.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

FACT_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID.name: FACT_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID
FACT_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

metadata.name: FACT_TRANSACTIONS
metadata.comment: Records of transactions that have occurred on Axelar, Cosmos, and Osmosis.

BLOCK_ID.name: BLOCK_ID
BLOCK_ID.comment: The block height the block was recorded at.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block began.

TX_ID.name: TX_ID
TX_ID.comment: A unique key that identifies a transaction. Called "TxHash" on block explorers.

TX_FROM.name: TX_FROM
TX_FROM.comment: The wallet address of the individual who initiated the transaction

FEE.name: FEE
FEE.comment: The fee is paid by the initiator of the transaction. Fee = gas * gas price.

FEE_DENOM.name: FEE_DENOM
FEE_DENOM.comment: The denominator of the transaction fee.

GAS_USED.name: GAS_USED
GAS_USED.comment: The amount of gas consumed by the transaction.

GAS_WANTED.name: GAS_WANTED
GAS_WANTED.comment: Amount of gas requested for a transaction. It is provided by users when the transaction is generated.

TX_CODE.name: TX_CODE
TX_CODE.comment: A number that corresponds to various error codes. When "0", the transaction is successful. Non-zero numbers signify different types of transaction failures.

TX_LOG.name: TX_LOG
TX_LOG.comment: A string that contains the transaction logs, which are logs written by the program interacted with during the transaction.

MSGS.name: MSGS
MSGS.comment: The underlying json from the messages or events within the transactions

TX_SUCCEEDED.name: TX_SUCCEEDED
TX_SUCCEEDED.comment: Transaction status is "TRUE" if the transaction was successful, "FALSE" if the transaction failed.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

FACT_TRANSACTIONS_ID.name: FACT_TRANSACTIONS_ID
FACT_TRANSACTIONS_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

metadata.name: DIM_LABELS
metadata.comment: The labels table is a store of one-to-one address identifiers, or an address name. Labels are broken out into a "type" (such as cex, dex, dapp, games, etc.) and a "subtype" (ex: contract_deployer, hot_wallet, token_contract, etc.) in order to help classify each address name into similar groups. Our labels are sourced from many different places, but can primarily be grouped into two categories: automatic and manual. Automatic labels are continuously labeled based on certain criteria, such as a known contract deploying another contract, behavior based algorithms for finding deposit wallets, and consistent data pulls of custom protocol APIs. Manual labels are done periodically to find addresses that cannot be found programatically such as finding new protocol addresses, centralized exchange hot wallets, or trending addresses. Labels can also be added by our community by using our add-a-label tool (https://science.flipsidecrypto.xyz/add-a-label/) or on-chain with near (https://near.social/lord1.near/widget/Form) and are reviewed by our labels team. A label can be removed by our labels team if it is found to be incorrect or no longer relevant; this generally will only happen for mislabeled deposit wallets.

INSERT_DATE.name: INSERT_DATE
INSERT_DATE.comment: The date the label was inserted in the table

ADDRESS.name: ADDRESS
ADDRESS.comment: Address that the label is for. This is the field that should be used to join other tables with labels.

CREATOR.name: CREATOR
CREATOR.comment: The name of the creator of the label

LABEL_TYPE.name: LABEL_TYPE
LABEL_TYPE.comment: A high-level category describing the addresses main function or ownership

LABEL_SUBTYPE.name: LABEL_SUBTYPE
LABEL_SUBTYPE.comment: A sub-category nested within label type providing further detail

PROJECT_NAME.name: PROJECT_NAME
PROJECT_NAME.comment: Name of the controlling entity of the address

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

DIM_LABELS_ID.name: DIM_LABELS_ID
DIM_LABELS_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

metadata.name: EZ_CORE_METRICS_HOURLY
metadata.comment: A convenience table that aggregates block and transaction related metrics using various aggregate functions such as SUM, COUNT, MIN and MAX from the fact_transactions table, on an hourly basis.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP_HOUR.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP_HOUR
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP_HOUR.comment: The hour of the timestamp of the block.

BLOCK_NUMBER_MIN.name: BLOCK_NUMBER_MIN
BLOCK_NUMBER_MIN.comment: The minimum block number in the hour.

BLOCK_NUMBER_MAX.name: BLOCK_NUMBER_MAX
BLOCK_NUMBER_MAX.comment: The maximum block number in the hour.

BLOCK_COUNT.name: BLOCK_COUNT
BLOCK_COUNT.comment: The number of blocks in the hour.

TRANSACTION_COUNT.name: TRANSACTION_COUNT
TRANSACTION_COUNT.comment: The number of transactions in the hour.

TRANSACTION_COUNT_SUCCESS.name: TRANSACTION_COUNT_SUCCESS
TRANSACTION_COUNT_SUCCESS.comment: The number of successful transactions in the hour.

TRANSACTION_COUNT_FAILED.name: TRANSACTION_COUNT_FAILED
TRANSACTION_COUNT_FAILED.comment: The number of failed transactions in the hour.

UNIQUE_FROM_COUNT.name: UNIQUE_FROM_COUNT
UNIQUE_FROM_COUNT.comment: The number of unique origin from addresses in the hour.

UNIQUE_TO_COUNT.name: UNIQUE_TO_COUNT
UNIQUE_TO_COUNT.comment: The number of unique origin to addresses in the hour.

TOTAL_FEES_NATIVE.name: TOTAL_FEES_NATIVE
TOTAL_FEES_NATIVE.comment: The sum of all fees in the hour, in the native fee currency. Note, Snowflake's native SUM() function may limit decimal precision. To view precise transaction fee values, please use the `tx_fee_precise` column in `core.fact_transactions`.

TOTAL_FEES_USD.name: TOTAL_FEES_USD
TOTAL_FEES_USD.comment: The sum of all fees in the hour, in USD, rounded to 2 decimal places.

EZ_CORE_METRICS_HOURLY_ID.name: EZ_CORE_METRICS_HOURLY_ID
EZ_CORE_METRICS_HOURLY_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_REPAYMENTS
metadata.comment: This table contains transactions in which a borrower repays their loan (debt) across the AAVE, COMPOUND, SILO, DFORCE, RADIANT, and LODESTAR protocols.  Loans are repaid in the same asset borrowed, plus accrued interest. Borrowers can pay back their loan based on the USD price as they can borrow any of the available stable coins (USDC, DAI, USDT, etc.).

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block was produced.

ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The from address of this transaction.

ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.comment: The to address of this transaction.

ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.name: ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.comment: The function signature of this transaction.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.

CONTRACT_ADDRESS.name: CONTRACT_ADDRESS
CONTRACT_ADDRESS.comment: The address interacted with for a given event.

EVENT_NAME.name: EVENT_NAME
EVENT_NAME.comment: The decoded event name for a given event.

PLATFORM.name: PLATFORM
PLATFORM.comment: The specific protocol where lending event occurred.

PAYER.name: PAYER
PAYER.comment: The address that initiated the repayment.

BORROWER.name: BORROWER
BORROWER.comment: Address that initiated the borrow event.

PROTOCOL_MARKET.name: PROTOCOL_MARKET
PROTOCOL_MARKET.comment: The protocol's specific lending asset token, ie cWBTC or aETHUni.

TOKEN_ADDRESS.name: TOKEN_ADDRESS
TOKEN_ADDRESS.comment: The address of the token associated with the lending action.

TOKEN_SYMBOL.name: TOKEN_SYMBOL
TOKEN_SYMBOL.comment: The symbol of the token associated with the lending action.

AMOUNT_UNADJ.name: AMOUNT_UNADJ
AMOUNT_UNADJ.comment: The non-decimal adjusted amount of tokens involved in the lending transaction.

AMOUNT.name: AMOUNT
AMOUNT.comment: The decimal adjusted amount of tokens involved in the lending transaction, where available.

AMOUNT_USD.name: AMOUNT_USD
AMOUNT_USD.comment: The value of the tokens in USD at the time of the lending transaction, where available.

EZ_LENDING_REPAYMENTS_ID.name: EZ_LENDING_REPAYMENTS_ID
EZ_LENDING_REPAYMENTS_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_FLASHLOANS
metadata.comment: This table contains flash loan transactions across AAVE and RADIANT protocols. Flash loans are a feature designed for developers, due to the technical knowledge required to execute one. Flash Loans allow you to borrow any available amount of assets without providing any collateral, as long as the liquidity is returned to the protocol within one block transaction.

metadata.name: EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY
metadata.comment: A convenience table that aggregates bridge activity from event_logs, traces and transfers, including bridge deposits and transfers sent from the following protocols: ACROSS, AXELAR, CELER, CBRIDGE, DLN, DEBRIDGE, EYWA, HOP, MESON, MULTICHAIN, STARGATE, SYMBIOSIS, SYNAPSE, WORMHOLE along with other helpful columns, including an amount USD where available. Note, this table only includes records for the protocols listed above with live, onchain bridge activity and may not represent the complete bridging picture.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block was produced.

ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The from address where the transaction originated from. This may be an EOA or contract address, however in most cases this is the user that initiated the bridge deposit or transfer.

ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.comment: The from address of this transaction.

ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.name: ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.comment: The function signature of this transaction.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.

BRIDGE_ADDRESS.name: BRIDGE_ADDRESS
BRIDGE_ADDRESS.comment: The address of the contract responsible for handling the bridge deposit or transfer. This contract mediates the transfer and ensures that assets are sent and received appropriately.

EVENT_NAME.name: EVENT_NAME
EVENT_NAME.comment: The decoded event name for a given event.

PLATFORM.name: PLATFORM
PLATFORM.comment: The platform or protocol from which the bridge transaction or event originates.

SENDER.name: SENDER
SENDER.comment: The address that initiated the bridge deposit or transfer. This address is the sender of the tokens/assets being bridged to the destination chain. This may be an EOA or contract address.

RECEIVER.name: RECEIVER
RECEIVER.comment: The designated address set to receive the deposit or transfer. This may be an EOA or contract address.

DESTINATION_CHAIN_RECEIVER.name: DESTINATION_CHAIN_RECEIVER
DESTINATION_CHAIN_RECEIVER.comment: The designated address set to receive the bridged tokens on the target chain after the completion of the bridge transaction. For non-evm chains, the hex address is decoded/encoded to match the data format of the destination chain, where possible. This may be an EOA or contract address.

DESTINATION_CHAIN.name: DESTINATION_CHAIN
DESTINATION_CHAIN.comment: The name of the blockchain network to which the assets are being bridged. It could be any EVM compatible chain or other blockchain networks that the bridging protocol supports.

DESTINATION_CHAIN_ID.name: DESTINATION_CHAIN_ID
DESTINATION_CHAIN_ID.comment: The numeric identifier associated with the destination blockchain network. This is specific to the chain and helps in uniquely identifying it.

TOKEN_ADDRESS.name: TOKEN_ADDRESS
TOKEN_ADDRESS.comment: The address associated with the token that is being bridged. It provides a unique identifier for the token within its origin blockchain.

TOKEN_SYMBOL.name: TOKEN_SYMBOL
TOKEN_SYMBOL.comment: The symbol representing the token being bridged. This provides a shorthand representation of the token.

AMOUNT_UNADJ.name: AMOUNT_UNADJ
AMOUNT_UNADJ.comment: The raw, non-decimal adjusted amount of tokens involved in the bridge transaction.

AMOUNT.name: AMOUNT
AMOUNT.comment: The decimal adjusted amount of tokens involved in the bridge transaction, where available.

AMOUNT_USD.name: AMOUNT_USD
AMOUNT_USD.comment: The value of the bridged tokens in USD at the time of the bridge transaction, where available.

EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID.name: EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID
EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: FACT_TRACES
metadata.comment: This table contains flattened trace data for internal contract calls on the Arbitrum Blockchain. Hex encoded fields can be decoded to integers by using `arbitrum.public.udf_hex_to_int()`.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: The transaction hash for the trace. Please note, this is not necessarily unique in this table as transactions frequently have multiple traces.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: The block number of this transaction.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The block timestamp of this transaction.

FROM_ADDRESS.name: FROM_ADDRESS
FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The sending address of this trace. This is not necessarily the from address of the transaction.

TO_ADDRESS.name: TO_ADDRESS
TO_ADDRESS.comment: The receiving address of this trace. This is not necessarily the to address of the transaction.

VALUE.name: VALUE
VALUE.comment: The amount of ETH transferred in this trace.

VALUE_PRECISE_RAW.name: VALUE_PRECISE_RAW
VALUE_PRECISE_RAW.comment: The precise, unadjusted amount of the transaction. This is returned as a string to avoid precision loss.

VALUE_PRECISE.name: VALUE_PRECISE
VALUE_PRECISE.comment: The precise, adjusted amount of the transaction. This is returned as a string to avoid precision loss.

GAS.name: GAS
GAS.comment: The gas supplied for this trace.

GAS_USED.name: GAS_USED
GAS_USED.comment: The gas used for this trace.

INPUT.name: INPUT
INPUT.comment: The input data for this trace.

OUTPUT.name: OUTPUT
OUTPUT.comment: The output data for this trace.

TYPE.name: TYPE
TYPE.comment: The type of internal transaction. Common trace types are `CALL`, `DELEGATECALL`, and `STATICCALL`.

IDENTIFIER.name: IDENTIFIER
IDENTIFIER.comment: This field represents the position and type of the trace within the transaction.

DATA.name: DATA
DATA.comment: The raw JSON data for this trace.

SUB_TRACES.name: SUB_TRACES
SUB_TRACES.comment: The amount of nested sub traces for this trace.

TRACE_STATUS.name: TRACE_STATUS
TRACE_STATUS.comment: The status of the trace, either `SUCCESS` or `FAIL`

ERROR_REASON.name: ERROR_REASON
ERROR_REASON.comment: The reason for the trace failure, if any.

TRACE_INDEX.name: TRACE_INDEX
TRACE_INDEX.comment: The index of the trace within the transaction.

BEFORE_EVM_TRANSFERS.name: BEFORE_EVM_TRANSFERS
BEFORE_EVM_TRANSFERS.comment: The state of all ETH transfers to be executed for a given transaction.

AFTER_EVM_TRANSFERS.name: AFTER_EVM_TRANSFERS
AFTER_EVM_TRANSFERS.comment: The state of all ETH transfers executed for a given transaction.

FACT_TRACES_ID.name: FACT_TRACES_ID
FACT_TRACES_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_DEPOSITS
metadata.comment: This table contains deposit transactions across AAVE, COMPOUND, SILO, DFORCE, RADIANT, and LODESTAR protocols. A user deposits their preferred asset and amount. After depositing, users earn passive income based on the market borrowing demand. Additionally, depositing allows users to borrow by using their deposited assets as a collateral. Any interest earned by depositing funds helps offset the interest rate accumulated by borrowing.

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_LIQUIDATIONS
metadata.comment: This table contains transactions in which a borrower's collateral asset is liquidated across AAVE, COMPOUND, SILO, DFORCE, RADIANT, and LODESTAR protocols. Liquidations occur when a borrower's health factor goes below 1 due to their collateral value not properly covering their loan/debt value. This might happen when the collateral decreases in value or the borrowed debt increases in value against each other. This collateral vs loan value ratio is shown in the health factor. In a liquidation, up to 50% of a borrower's debt is repaid and that value + liquidation fee is taken from the collateral available, so after a liquidation the amount liquidated from one's debt is repaid.

metadata.name: EZ_DEX_SWAPS
metadata.comment:
This table currently contains swap events from the ```fact_event_logs``` table for TRADER JOE, WOOFI, GMX, KYBERSWAP, ZYBERSWAP, DODO, FRAX, CAMELOT, UNISWAP, HASHFLOW, SUSHI, CURVE and BALANCER along with other helpful columns including an amount USD where possible. Other dexes coming soon! 
Note: A rule has been put in place to null out the amount_USD if that number is too divergent between amount_in_USD and amount_out_usd. This can happen for swaps of less liquid tokens during very high fluctuation of price.

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_LIQUIDATIONS
metadata.comment: This table contains transactions in which a borrower's collateral asset is liquidated across AAVE, BENQI, and TRADER JOE protocols. Liquidations occur when a borrower's health factor goes below 1 due to their collateral value not properly covering their loan/debt value. This might happen when the collateral decreases in value or the borrowed debt increases in value against each other. This collateral vs loan value ratio is shown in the health factor. In a liquidation, up to 50% of a borrower's debt is repaid and that value + liquidation fee is taken from the collateral available, so after a liquidation the amount liquidated from one's debt is repaid.

metadata.name: EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY
metadata.comment: A convenience table that aggregates bridge activity from event_logs, traces and transfers, including bridge deposits and transfers sent from the following protocols: ALLBRIDGE, AXELAR, CELER, CBRIDGE, DLN, DEBRIDGE, EYWA, MESON, MULTICHAIN, STARGATE, SYMBIOSIS, SYNAPSE, WORMHOLE along with other helpful columns, including an amount USD where available. Note, this table only includes records for the protocols listed above with live, onchain bridge activity and may not represent the complete bridging picture.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block was produced.

ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The from address where the transaction originated from. This may be an EOA or contract address, however in most cases this is the user that initiated the bridge deposit or transfer.

ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.comment: The from address of this transaction.

ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.name: ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.comment: The function signature of this transaction.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.

BRIDGE_ADDRESS.name: BRIDGE_ADDRESS
BRIDGE_ADDRESS.comment: The address of the contract responsible for handling the bridge deposit or transfer. This contract mediates the transfer and ensures that assets are sent and received appropriately.

EVENT_NAME.name: EVENT_NAME
EVENT_NAME.comment: The decoded event name for a given event.

PLATFORM.name: PLATFORM
PLATFORM.comment: The platform or protocol from which the bridge transaction or event originates.

SENDER.name: SENDER
SENDER.comment: The address that initiated the bridge deposit or transfer. This address is the sender of the tokens/assets being bridged to the destination chain. This may be an EOA or contract address.

RECEIVER.name: RECEIVER
RECEIVER.comment: The designated address set to receive the deposit or transfer. This may be an EOA or contract address.

DESTINATION_CHAIN_RECEIVER.name: DESTINATION_CHAIN_RECEIVER
DESTINATION_CHAIN_RECEIVER.comment: The designated address set to receive the bridged tokens on the target chain after the completion of the bridge transaction. For non-evm chains, the hex address is decoded/encoded to match the data format of the destination chain, where possible. This may be an EOA or contract address.

DESTINATION_CHAIN.name: DESTINATION_CHAIN
DESTINATION_CHAIN.comment: The name of the blockchain network to which the assets are being bridged. It could be any EVM compatible chain or other blockchain networks that the bridging protocol supports.

DESTINATION_CHAIN_ID.name: DESTINATION_CHAIN_ID
DESTINATION_CHAIN_ID.comment: The numeric identifier associated with the destination blockchain network. This is specific to the chain and helps in uniquely identifying it.

TOKEN_ADDRESS.name: TOKEN_ADDRESS

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_WITHDRAWS
metadata.comment: This table contains transactions in which a user withdraws liquidity across the AAVE, BENQI, and TRADER JOE protocols. Users need to make sure there is enough liquidity (not borrowed) in order to withdraw, if this is not the case, users need to wait for more liquidity from depositors or borrowers repaying.

PLATFORM.comment: The specific protocol where lending event occurred.

DEPOSITOR.comment: Its the address of the user who is Borrowing or repaying the loan, depending on the action.

metadata.name: EZ_DEX_SWAPS
metadata.comment:
This table currently contains swap events from the ```fact_event_logs``` table for TRADER JOE, WOOFI, GMX, KYBERSWAP, FRAX, HASHFLOW, SUSHI, and CURVE along with other helpful columns including an amount USD where possible. Other dexes coming soon! 
Note: A rule has been put in place to null out the amount_USD if that number is too divergent between amount_in_USD and amount_out_usd. This can happen for swaps of less liquid tokens during very high fluctuation of price.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block was produced.

TX_HASH.comment: Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.

ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.comment: The function signature of the contract call.

ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The from address of this transaction.

ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.comment: The to address of this transaction.

CONTRACT_ADDRESS.name: CONTRACT_ADDRESS
CONTRACT_ADDRESS.comment: The address interacted with for a given event.

EVENT_NAME.name: EVENT_NAME
EVENT_NAME.comment: The decoded event name for a given event.

AMOUNT_IN_UNADJ.name: AMOUNT_IN_UNADJ
AMOUNT_IN_UNADJ.comment: The non-decimal adjusted amount of tokens put into the swap.

AMOUNT_IN.name: AMOUNT_IN
AMOUNT_IN.comment: The amount of tokens put into the swap.

AMOUNT_IN_USD.name: AMOUNT_IN_USD
AMOUNT_IN_USD.comment: The amount of tokens put into the swap converted to USD using the price of the token.

AMOUNT_OUT_UNADJ.name: AMOUNT_OUT_UNADJ
AMOUNT_OUT_UNADJ.comment: The non-decimal adjusted amount of tokens taken out of or received from the swap.

AMOUNT_OUT.name: AMOUNT_OUT
AMOUNT_OUT.comment: The amount of tokens taken out of or received from the swap.

AMOUNT_OUT_USD.name: AMOUNT_OUT_USD
AMOUNT_OUT_USD.comment: The amount of tokens taken out of or received from the swap converted to USD using the price of the token.

SENDER.name: SENDER
SENDER.comment: The Router is the Sender in the swap function.

TX_TO.name: TX_TO
TX_TO.comment: The tx_to is the address who receives the swapped token. This corresponds to the "to" field in the swap function.

PLATFORM.name: PLATFORM
PLATFORM.comment: The protocol or platform that the liquidity pool belongs to or swap occurred on.

TOKEN_IN.name: TOKEN_IN
TOKEN_IN.comment: The address of the token sent for swap.

TOKEN_OUT.name: TOKEN_OUT
TOKEN_OUT.comment: The address of the token being swapped to.

SYMBOL_IN.name: SYMBOL_IN
SYMBOL_IN.comment: The symbol of the token sent for swap.

SYMBOL_OUT.name: SYMBOL_OUT
SYMBOL_OUT.comment: The symbol of the token being swapped to.

_LOG_ID.name: _LOG_ID
_LOG_ID.comment: Deprecated. This column is no longer used. Please remove from your query by Jan. 31 2024.'

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_FLASHLOANS
metadata.comment: This table contains flash loan transactions across AAVE protocol. Flash loans are a feature designed for developers, due to the technical knowledge required to execute one. Flash Loans allow you to borrow any available amount of assets without providing any collateral, as long as the liquidity is returned to the protocol within one block transaction.

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_DEPOSITS
metadata.comment: This table contains deposit transactions across AAVE, BENQI, and TRADER JOE protocols. A user deposits their preferred asset and amount. After depositing, users earn passive income based on the market borrowing demand. Additionally, depositing allows users to borrow by using their deposited assets as a collateral. Any interest earned by depositing funds helps offset the interest rate accumulated by borrowing.

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_WITHDRAWS
metadata.comment: This table contains transactions in which a user withdraws liquidity across the AAVE and COMPOUND protocols. Users need to make sure there is enough liquidity (not borrowed) in order to withdraw, if this is not the case, users need to wait for more liquidity from depositors or borrowers repaying.

ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The from address of this transaction.

ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.comment: The to address of this transaction.

PLATFORM.name: PLATFORM
PLATFORM.comment: The specific protocol where lending event occurred.

DEPOSITOR.name: DEPOSITOR
DEPOSITOR.comment: Its the address of the user who is Borrowing or repaying the loan, depending on the action.

PROTOCOL_MARKET.name: PROTOCOL_MARKET
PROTOCOL_MARKET.comment: The protocol's specific lending asset token, ie cWBTC or aETHUni.

TOKEN_SYMBOL.comment: The symbol of the token associated with the lending action.

metadata.name: EZ_DEX_SWAPS
metadata.comment:
This table currently contains swap events from the ```fact_event_logs``` table for WOOFI, KYBERSWAP, DODO, QUICKSWAP, FRAX, UNISWAP, BALANCER, HASHFLOW, SUSHI and CURVE along with other helpful columns including an amount USD where possible. Other dexes coming soon! 
Note: A rule has been put in place to null out the amount_USD if that number is too divergent between amount_in_USD and amount_out_usd. This can happen for swaps of less liquid tokens during very high fluctuation of price.

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_LIQUIDATIONS
metadata.comment: This table contains transactions in which a borrower's collateral asset is liquidated across AAVE and COMPOUND protocols. Liquidations occur when a borrower's health factor goes below 1 due to their collateral value not properly covering their loan/debt value. This might happen when the collateral decreases in value or the borrowed debt increases in value against each other. This collateral vs loan value ratio is shown in the health factor. In a liquidation, up to 50% of a borrower's debt is repaid and that value + liquidation fee is taken from the collateral available, so after a liquidation the amount liquidated from one's debt is repaid.

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_DEPOSITS
metadata.comment: This table contains deposit transactions across AAVE and COMPOUND protocols. A user deposits their preferred asset and amount. After depositing, users earn passive income based on the market borrowing demand. Additionally, depositing allows users to borrow by using their deposited assets as a collateral. Any interest earned by depositing funds helps offset the interest rate accumulated by borrowing.

metadata.name: EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY
metadata.comment: A convenience table that aggregates bridge activity from event_logs, traces and transfers, including bridge deposits and transfers sent from the following protocols: ACROSS, ALLBRIDGE, AXELAR, CELER, CBRIDGE, DLN, DEBRIDGE, EYWA, HOP, MESON, MULTICHAIN, STARGATE, SYMBIOSIS, SYNAPSE, WORMHOLE along with other helpful columns, including an amount USD where available. Note, this table only includes records for the protocols listed above with live, onchain bridge activity and may not represent the complete bridging picture.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block was produced.

ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The from address where the transaction originated from. This may be an EOA or contract address, however in most cases this is the user that initiated the bridge deposit or transfer.

ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.comment: The from address of this transaction.

ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.name: ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.comment: The function signature of this transaction.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.

BRIDGE_ADDRESS.name: BRIDGE_ADDRESS
BRIDGE_ADDRESS.comment: The address of the contract responsible for handling the bridge deposit or transfer. This contract mediates the transfer and ensures that assets are sent and received appropriately.

EVENT_NAME.name: EVENT_NAME
EVENT_NAME.comment: The decoded event name for a given event.

PLATFORM.name: PLATFORM
PLATFORM.comment: The platform or protocol from which the bridge transaction or event originates.

SENDER.name: SENDER
SENDER.comment: The address that initiated the bridge deposit or transfer. This address is the sender of the tokens/assets being bridged to the destination chain. This may be an EOA or contract address.

RECEIVER.name: RECEIVER
RECEIVER.comment: The designated address set to receive the deposit or transfer. This may be an EOA or contract address.

DESTINATION_CHAIN_RECEIVER.name: DESTINATION_CHAIN_RECEIVER
DESTINATION_CHAIN_RECEIVER.comment: The designated address set to receive the bridged tokens on the target chain after the completion of the bridge transaction. For non-evm chains, the hex address is decoded/encoded to match the data format of the destination chain, where possible. This may be an EOA or contract address.

DESTINATION_CHAIN.name: DESTINATION_CHAIN
DESTINATION_CHAIN.comment: The name of the blockchain network to which the assets are being bridged. It could be any EVM compatible chain or other blockchain networks that the bridging protocol supports.

DESTINATION_CHAIN_ID.name: DESTINATION_CHAIN_ID
DESTINATION_CHAIN_ID.comment: The numeric identifier associated with the destination blockchain network. This is specific to the chain and helps in uniquely identifying it.

TOKEN_ADDRESS.name: TOKEN_ADDRESS
TOKEN_ADDRESS.comment: The address associated with the token that is being bridged. It provides a unique identifier for the token within its origin blockchain.

TOKEN_SYMBOL.name: TOKEN_SYMBOL
TOKEN_SYMBOL.comment: The symbol representing the token being bridged. This provides a shorthand representation of the token.

AMOUNT_UNADJ.name: AMOUNT_UNADJ
AMOUNT_UNADJ.comment: The raw, non-decimal adjusted amount of tokens involved in the bridge transaction.

AMOUNT.name: AMOUNT
AMOUNT.comment: The decimal adjusted amount of tokens involved in the bridge transaction, where available.

AMOUNT_USD.name: AMOUNT_USD
AMOUNT_USD.comment: The value of the bridged tokens in USD at the time of the bridge transaction, where available.

EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID.name: EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID
EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: FACT_TRACES
metadata.comment: This table contains flattened trace data for internal contract calls on the Polygon Blockchain. Hex encoded fields can be decoded to integers by using `polygon.public.udf_hex_to_int()`.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: The transaction hash for the trace. Please note, this is not necessarily unique in this table as transactions frequently have multiple traces.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: The block number of this transaction.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The block timestamp of this transaction.

FROM_ADDRESS.name: FROM_ADDRESS
FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The sending address of this trace. This is not necessarily the from address of the transaction.

TO_ADDRESS.name: TO_ADDRESS
TO_ADDRESS.comment: The receiving address of this trace. This is not necessarily the to address of the transaction.

VALUE.name: VALUE
VALUE.comment: The amount of MATIC transferred in this trace.

VALUE_PRECISE_RAW.name: VALUE_PRECISE_RAW
VALUE_PRECISE_RAW.comment: The precise, unadjusted amount of the transaction. This is returned as a string to avoid precision loss.

VALUE_PRECISE.name: VALUE_PRECISE
VALUE_PRECISE.comment: The precise, adjusted amount of the transaction. This is returned as a string to avoid precision loss.

GAS.name: GAS
GAS.comment: The gas supplied for this trace.

GAS_USED.name: GAS_USED
GAS_USED.comment: The gas used for this trace.

INPUT.name: INPUT
INPUT.comment: The input data for this trace.

OUTPUT.name: OUTPUT
OUTPUT.comment: The output data for this trace.

TYPE.name: TYPE
TYPE.comment: The type of internal transaction. Common trace types are `CALL`, `DELEGATECALL`, and `STATICCALL`.

IDENTIFIER.name: IDENTIFIER
IDENTIFIER.comment: This field represents the position and type of the trace within the transaction.

DATA.name: DATA
DATA.comment: The raw JSON data for this trace.

SUB_TRACES.name: SUB_TRACES
SUB_TRACES.comment: The amount of nested sub traces for this trace.

TRACE_STATUS.name: TRACE_STATUS
TRACE_STATUS.comment: The status of the trace, either `SUCCESS` or `FAIL`

ERROR_REASON.name: ERROR_REASON
ERROR_REASON.comment: The reason for the trace failure, if any.

TRACE_INDEX.name: TRACE_INDEX
TRACE_INDEX.comment: The index of the trace within the transaction.

FACT_TRACES_ID.name: FACT_TRACES_ID
FACT_TRACES_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_REPAYMENTS
metadata.comment: This table contains transactions in which a borrower repays their loan (debt) across the AAVE and COMPOUND protocols.  Loans are repaid in the same asset borrowed, plus accrued interest. Borrowers can pay back their loan based on the USD price as they can borrow any of the available stable coins (USDC, DAI, USDT, etc.).

BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP

ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The from address of this transaction.

ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.comment: The to address of this transaction.

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_LIQUIDATIONS
metadata.comment: This table contains transactions in which a borrower's collateral asset is liquidated across AAVE, COMPOUND, CREAM, FLUX, FRAXLEND, RADIANT, SILO, SPARK, STRIKE, STURDY, and UWU protocols. Liquidations occur when a borrower's health factor goes below 1 due to their collateral value not properly covering their loan/debt value. This might happen when the collateral decreases in value or the borrowed debt increases in value against each other. This collateral vs loan value ratio is shown in the health factor. In a liquidation, up to 50% of a borrower's debt is repaid and that value + liquidation fee is taken from the collateral available, so after a liquidation the amount liquidated from one's debt is repaid.

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_DEPOSITS
metadata.comment: This table contains deposit transactions across AAVE, COMPOUND, CREAM, FLUX, FRAXLEND, RADIANT, SILO, SPARK, STRIKE, STURDY, and UWU protocols. A user deposits their preferred asset and amount. After depositing, users earn passive income based on the market borrowing demand. Additionally, depositing allows users to borrow by using their deposited assets as a collateral. Any interest earned by depositing funds helps offset the interest rate accumulated by borrowing.

metadata.name: EZ_CURRENT_BALANCES
metadata.comment:
This table contains the current, non 0, balances for wallets on the Ethereum Blockchain. Symbol, name, and price are joined where possible. Prices are calculated as of the last activity date and as of the most recently recorded hourly price. ERC721s are included.

Please note - the underlying data for this is large. If you want your query to run quickly, please use filters as much as possible. Using at least `last_activity_block_timestamp::date` as a filter will lead to optimal query performance.

LAST_ACTIVITY_BLOCK.name: LAST_ACTIVITY_BLOCK
LAST_ACTIVITY_BLOCK.comment: The last block where this token was transferred by this address.

USER_ADDRESS.name: USER_ADDRESS
USER_ADDRESS.comment: The wallet address holding the tokens / ETH.

CONTRACT_ADDRESS.name: CONTRACT_ADDRESS
CONTRACT_ADDRESS.comment: The contract address of the token (null for ETH).

CURRENT_BAL_UNADJ.name: CURRENT_BAL_UNADJ
CURRENT_BAL_UNADJ.comment: The current token or ETH balance for this address, without a decimal adjustment.

CURRENT_BAL.name: CURRENT_BAL
CURRENT_BAL.comment: The decimal adjusted current token or ETH balance.

USD_VALUE_LAST_ACTIVITY.name: USD_VALUE_LAST_ACTIVITY
USD_VALUE_LAST_ACTIVITY.comment: The value of the tokens or ETH in USD, at the time the last token activity occurred. Will be null for tokens without a decimal.

USD_VALUE_NOW.name: USD_VALUE_NOW
USD_VALUE_NOW.comment: The value of the tokens or ETH in USD, as of the most recently recorded hourly price. Will be null for tokens without a decimal.

SYMBOL.name: SYMBOL
SYMBOL.comment: The symbol of the token contract, or ETH.

TOKEN_NAME.name: TOKEN_NAME
TOKEN_NAME.comment: The name of the token contract, or Native ETH.

DECIMALS.name: DECIMALS
DECIMALS.comment: The decimals for the token contract.

HAS_DECIMAL.name: HAS_DECIMAL
HAS_DECIMAL.comment: Whether the token has a decimal or not, either TRUE or FALSE.

HAS_PRICE.name: HAS_PRICE
HAS_PRICE.comment: Whether the token has an hourly price or not, either TRUE or FALSE.

LAST_RECORDED_PRICE.name: LAST_RECORDED_PRICE
LAST_RECORDED_PRICE.comment: The timestamp of the last hourly price recorded for this token.

EZ_CURRENT_BALANCES_ID.name: EZ_CURRENT_BALANCES_ID
EZ_CURRENT_BALANCES_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: FACT_TOKEN_TRANSFERS
metadata.comment: This table contains events on the Ethereum Blockchain with an event name of 'Transfer'. The contract address is the token transferred, and the raw amount field is the amount of tokens transferred. Please note this amount is not decimal adjusted. Decimal adjustments for a token address can be found in ```dim_contracts```. This table will not contain transfers of native ETH.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block was produced.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This will not be unique in this table as a transaction could include multiple transfer events.

ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.name: ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.comment: The function signature of this transaction.

ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The from address at the transaction level.

ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.comment: The to address at the transaction level.

CONTRACT_ADDRESS.name: CONTRACT_ADDRESS
CONTRACT_ADDRESS.comment: Contract address of the token being transferred.

FROM_ADDRESS.name: FROM_ADDRESS
FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The sending address of this transfer.

TO_ADDRESS.name: TO_ADDRESS
TO_ADDRESS.comment: The receiving address of this transfer. This can be a contract address.

RAW_AMOUNT.name: RAW_AMOUNT
RAW_AMOUNT.comment: The amount of tokens transferred. This value is not decimal adjusted.

RAW_AMOUNT_PRECISE.name: RAW_AMOUNT_PRECISE
RAW_AMOUNT_PRECISE.comment: The amount of tokens transferred returned as a string to preserve precision. This value is not decimal adjusted.

_LOG_ID.name: _LOG_ID
_LOG_ID.comment: Deprecated. This column is no longer used. Please remove from your query by Jan. 10 2024.'

FACT_TOKEN_TRANSFERS_ID.name: FACT_TOKEN_TRANSFERS_ID
FACT_TOKEN_TRANSFERS_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: EZ_CORE_METRICS_HOURLY
metadata.comment: A convenience table that aggregates block and transaction related metrics using various aggregate functions such as SUM, COUNT, MIN and MAX from the fact_transactions table, on an hourly basis.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP_HOUR.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP_HOUR
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP_HOUR.comment: The hour of the timestamp of the block.

BLOCK_NUMBER_MIN.name: BLOCK_NUMBER_MIN
BLOCK_NUMBER_MIN.comment: The minimum block number in the hour.

BLOCK_NUMBER_MAX.name: BLOCK_NUMBER_MAX
BLOCK_NUMBER_MAX.comment: The maximum block number in the hour.

BLOCK_COUNT.name: BLOCK_COUNT
BLOCK_COUNT.comment: The number of blocks in the hour.

TRANSACTION_COUNT.name: TRANSACTION_COUNT
TRANSACTION_COUNT.comment: The number of transactions in the hour.

TRANSACTION_COUNT_SUCCESS.name: TRANSACTION_COUNT_SUCCESS
TRANSACTION_COUNT_SUCCESS.comment: The number of successful transactions in the hour.

TRANSACTION_COUNT_FAILED.name: TRANSACTION_COUNT_FAILED
TRANSACTION_COUNT_FAILED.comment: The number of failed transactions in the hour.

UNIQUE_FROM_COUNT.name: UNIQUE_FROM_COUNT
UNIQUE_FROM_COUNT.comment: The number of unique origin from addresses in the hour.

UNIQUE_TO_COUNT.name: UNIQUE_TO_COUNT
UNIQUE_TO_COUNT.comment: The number of unique origin to addresses in the hour.

TOTAL_FEES_NATIVE.name: TOTAL_FEES_NATIVE
TOTAL_FEES_NATIVE.comment: The sum of all fees in the hour, in the native fee currency. Note, Snowflake's native SUM() function may limit decimal precision. To view precise transaction fee values, please use the `tx_fee_precise` column in `core.fact_transactions`.

TOTAL_FEES_USD.name: TOTAL_FEES_USD
TOTAL_FEES_USD.comment: The sum of all fees in the hour, in USD, rounded to 2 decimal places.

EZ_CORE_METRICS_HOURLY_ID.name: EZ_CORE_METRICS_HOURLY_ID
EZ_CORE_METRICS_HOURLY_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: FACT_TRACES
metadata.comment: This table contains flattened trace data for internal contract calls on the Ethereum blockchain. Hex encoded fields can be decoded to integers by using `TO_NUMBER(<FIELD>, 'XXXXXXXXXXXX')`, with the number of Xs being the max length of the encoded field. You must also remove the `0x` from your field to use the `TO_NUMBER()` function, if applicable.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: The transaction hash for the trace. Please note, this is not necessarily unique in this table as transactions frequently have multiple traces.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: The block number of this transaction.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The block timestamp of this transaction.

FROM_ADDRESS.name: FROM_ADDRESS
FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The sending address of this trace. This is not necessarily the from address of the transaction.

TO_ADDRESS.name: TO_ADDRESS
TO_ADDRESS.comment: The receiving address of this trace. This is not necessarily the to address of the transaction.

VALUE.name: VALUE
VALUE.comment: The amount of ETH transferred in this trace.

VALUE_PRECISE_RAW.name: VALUE_PRECISE_RAW
VALUE_PRECISE_RAW.comment: The precise, unadjusted amount of the transaction. This is returned as a string to avoid precision loss.

VALUE_PRECISE.name: VALUE_PRECISE
VALUE_PRECISE.comment: The precise, adjusted amount of the transaction. This is returned as a string to avoid precision loss.

GAS.name: GAS
GAS.comment: The gas supplied for this trace.

GAS_USED.name: GAS_USED
GAS_USED.comment: The gas used for this trace.

INPUT.name: INPUT
INPUT.comment: The input data for this trace.

OUTPUT.name: OUTPUT
OUTPUT.comment: The output data for this trace.

TYPE.name: TYPE
TYPE.comment: The type of internal transaction. Common trace types are `CALL`, `DELEGATECALL`, and `STATICCALL`.

IDENTIFIER.name: IDENTIFIER
IDENTIFIER.comment: This field represents the position and type of the trace within the transaction.

DATA.name: DATA
DATA.comment: The raw JSON data for this trace.

SUB_TRACES.name: SUB_TRACES
SUB_TRACES.comment: The amount of nested sub traces for this trace.

TRACE_STATUS.name: TRACE_STATUS
TRACE_STATUS.comment: The status of the trace, either `SUCCESS` or `FAIL`

ERROR_REASON.name: ERROR_REASON
ERROR_REASON.comment: The reason for the trace failure, if any.

TRACE_INDEX.name: TRACE_INDEX
TRACE_INDEX.comment: The index of the trace within the transaction.

FACT_TRACES_ID.name: FACT_TRACES_ID
FACT_TRACES_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table
