bytes.description: Approximate size of the table as reported by Snowflake

clustering_key.label: Clustering Key
clustering_key.description: The key used to cluster this table

row_count.label: Row Count
row_count.description: An approximate count of rows in this table

metadata.name: EZ_DEX_SWAPS
metadata.comment:
This table currently contains swap events from the ```fact_event_logs``` table for SUSHI, UNISWAP, CURVE, SYNTHETIX, BALANCER, DODO, FRAX, HASHFLOW, KYBERSWAP, MAVERICK, PANCAKESWAP, SHIBASWAP, TRADER JOE, AND VERSE along with other helpful columns including an amount USD where possible. Other dexes coming soon! 
Note: A rule has been put in place to null out the amount_USD if that number is too divergent between amount_in_USD and amount_out_usd. This can happen for swaps of less liquid tokens during very high fluctuation of price.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block was produced.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.

ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.name: ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.comment: The function signature of this transaction.

ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The from address at the transaction level.

CONTRACT_ADDRESS.name: CONTRACT_ADDRESS
CONTRACT_ADDRESS.comment: The address interacted with for a given event.

EVENT_NAME.name: EVENT_NAME
EVENT_NAME.comment: The decoded event name for a given event.

AMOUNT_IN_UNADJ.name: AMOUNT_IN_UNADJ
AMOUNT_IN_UNADJ.comment: The non-decimal adjusted amount of tokens put into the swap.

AMOUNT_IN.name: AMOUNT_IN
AMOUNT_IN.comment: The amount of tokens put into the swap.

AMOUNT_IN_USD.name: AMOUNT_IN_USD
AMOUNT_IN_USD.comment: The amount of tokens put into the swap converted to USD using the price of the token.

AMOUNT_OUT_UNADJ.name: AMOUNT_OUT_UNADJ
AMOUNT_OUT_UNADJ.comment: The non-decimal adjusted amount of tokens taken out of or received from the swap.

AMOUNT_OUT.name: AMOUNT_OUT
AMOUNT_OUT.comment: The amount of tokens taken out of or received from the swap.

AMOUNT_OUT_USD.name: AMOUNT_OUT_USD
AMOUNT_OUT_USD.comment: The amount of tokens taken out of or received from the swap converted to USD using the price of the token.

SENDER.name: SENDER
SENDER.comment: The Router is the Sender in the swap function.

TX_TO.name: TX_TO
TX_TO.comment: The tx_to is the address who receives the swapped token. This corresponds to the "to" field in the swap function.

PLATFORM.name: PLATFORM
PLATFORM.comment: The protocol or platform that the liquidity pool belongs to or swap occurred on.

TOKEN_IN.name: TOKEN_IN
TOKEN_IN.comment: The address of the token sent for swap.

TOKEN_OUT.name: TOKEN_OUT
TOKEN_OUT.comment: The address of the token being swapped to.

SYMBOL_IN.name: SYMBOL_IN
SYMBOL_IN.comment: The symbol of the token sent for swap.

SYMBOL_OUT.name: SYMBOL_OUT
SYMBOL_OUT.comment: The symbol of the token being swapped to.

_LOG_ID.name: _LOG_ID
_LOG_ID.comment: Deprecated. This column is no longer used. Please remove from your query by Jan. 10 2024.'

EZ_DEX_SWAPS_ID.name: EZ_DEX_SWAPS_ID
EZ_DEX_SWAPS_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

bytes.description: Approximate size of the table as reported by Snowflake

metadata.name: FACT_TRANSACTIONS
metadata.comment: This table contains transaction level data for the Ethereum Blockchain. Each transaction will have a unique transaction hash, along with transactions fees and an ETH value transferred when applicable. Transactions may be native ETH transfers or interactions with contract addresses. For more information, please see [The Ethereum Organization - Transactions](https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/transactions/)

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block was produced.

BLOCK_HASH.name: BLOCK_HASH
BLOCK_HASH.comment: Block hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generate when a block is produced.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed.

NONCE.name: NONCE
NONCE.comment: The number of transactions sent from a given address.

POSITION.name: POSITION
POSITION.comment: The position of the transaction within the block.

ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.name: ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.comment: The function signature of the contract call.

FROM_ADDRESS.name: FROM_ADDRESS
FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The sending address of this transaction.

TO_ADDRESS.name: TO_ADDRESS
TO_ADDRESS.comment: The receiving address of this transaction. This can be a contract address.

VALUE_PRECISE_RAW.name: VALUE_PRECISE_RAW
VALUE_PRECISE_RAW.comment: The precise, unadjusted amount of the transaction. This is returned as a string to avoid precision loss.

VALUE_PRECISE.name: VALUE_PRECISE
VALUE_PRECISE.comment: The precise, adjusted amount of the transaction. This is returned as a string to avoid precision loss.

TX_FEE.name: TX_FEE
TX_FEE.comment: Amount paid to validate the transaction in Ether.

GAS_PRICE.name: GAS_PRICE
GAS_PRICE.comment: Cost per unit of gas in Gwei.

GAS_LIMIT.name: GAS_LIMIT
GAS_LIMIT.comment: Maximum amount of gas allocated for the transaction.

CUMULATIVE_GAS_USED.name: CUMULATIVE_GAS_USED
CUMULATIVE_GAS_USED.comment: The total amount of gas used when this transaction was executed in the block.

INPUT_DATA.name: INPUT_DATA
INPUT_DATA.comment: This column contains additional data for this transaction, and is commonly used as part of a contract interaction or as a message to the recipient.

EFFECTIVE_GAS_PRICE.name: EFFECTIVE_GAS_PRICE
EFFECTIVE_GAS_PRICE.comment: The effective gas price of the transaction, in wei.

MAX_FEE_PER_GAS.name: MAX_FEE_PER_GAS
MAX_FEE_PER_GAS.comment: The maximum fee per gas of the transaction, in wei.

MAX_PRIORITY_FEE_PER_GAS.name: MAX_PRIORITY_FEE_PER_GAS
MAX_PRIORITY_FEE_PER_GAS.comment: The maximum priority fee per gas of the transaction, in wei.

R.name: R
R.comment: The r value of the transaction signature.

S.name: S
S.comment: The s value of the transaction signature.

V.name: V
V.comment: The v value of the transaction signature.

TX_TYPE.name: TX_TYPE
TX_TYPE.comment: The type of the transaction, 2 for EIP-1559 transactions and 0 for legacy transactions.

CHAIN_ID.name: CHAIN_ID
CHAIN_ID.comment: The chain ID of the transaction.

BLOB_VERSIONED_HASHES.name: BLOB_VERSIONED_HASHES
BLOB_VERSIONED_HASHES.comment: A list of hashed outputs from kzg_to_versioned_hash.

MAX_FEE_PER_BLOB_GAS.name: MAX_FEE_PER_BLOB_GAS
MAX_FEE_PER_BLOB_GAS.comment: The maximum fee a user is willing to pay per blob gas.

BLOB_GAS_USED.name: BLOB_GAS_USED
BLOB_GAS_USED.comment: The total amount of blob gas consumed by transactions in the block.

BLOB_GAS_PRICE.name: BLOB_GAS_PRICE
BLOB_GAS_PRICE.comment: The price of blob gas in wei.

FACT_TRANSACTIONS_ID.name: FACT_TRANSACTIONS_ID
FACT_TRANSACTIONS_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

metadata.name: EZ_NATIVE_TRANSFERS
metadata.comment: This table contains all native ETH transfers, including equivalent USD amounts. The origin addresses correspond to the to and from addresses from the `fact_transactions` table. The `identifier` and `tx_hash` columns relate this table back to `fact_traces`, which contains more details on the transfers.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This will not be unique in this table as a transaction could include multiple transfer events.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block was produced.

TX_POSITION.name: TX_POSITION
TX_POSITION.comment: The position of the transaction within the block.

TRACE_INDEX.name: TRACE_INDEX
TRACE_INDEX.comment: The index of the trace within the transaction.

IDENTIFIER.name: IDENTIFIER
IDENTIFIER.comment: This field represents the position and type of the trace within the transaction.

ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The from address at the transaction level.

ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.comment: The to address at the transaction level.

ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.name: ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.comment: The function signature of this transaction.

FROM_ADDRESS.name: FROM_ADDRESS
FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The sending address of this transfer.

TO_ADDRESS.name: TO_ADDRESS
TO_ADDRESS.comment: The receiving address of this transfer. This can be a contract address.

AMOUNT.name: AMOUNT
AMOUNT.comment: ETH value transferred.

AMOUNT_PRECISE_RAW.name: AMOUNT_PRECISE_RAW
AMOUNT_PRECISE_RAW.comment: The precise, unadjusted amount of the transaction. This is returned as a string to avoid precision loss.

AMOUNT_PRECISE.name: AMOUNT_PRECISE
AMOUNT_PRECISE.comment: The precise, adjusted amount of the transaction. This is returned as a string to avoid precision loss.

AMOUNT_USD.name: AMOUNT_USD
AMOUNT_USD.comment: ETH value transferred, in USD.

EZ_NATIVE_TRANSFERS_ID.name: EZ_NATIVE_TRANSFERS_ID
EZ_NATIVE_TRANSFERS_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

metadata.name: EZ_NFT_SALES
metadata.comment: This table contains NFT sale events from Opensea (Wyvern & Seaport), Blur, Rarible, X2Y2, Looksrare, NFTx, Sudoswap, and Larvalabs (Cryptopunks)

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: The block number at which the NFT event occurred.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The block timestamp at which the NFT event occurred.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: The transaction hash for the NFT event. This is not necessarily unique in this table as a transaction may contain multiple NFT events.

EVENT_INDEX.name: EVENT_INDEX
EVENT_INDEX.comment: The event number within a transaction

EVENT_TYPE.name: EVENT_TYPE
EVENT_TYPE.comment: The type of NFT event in this transaction, either `sale`,  `bid_won` or `redeem`.

PLATFORM_ADDRESS.name: PLATFORM_ADDRESS
PLATFORM_ADDRESS.comment: The address of the exchange used for the transaction.

PLATFORM_NAME.name: PLATFORM_NAME
PLATFORM_NAME.comment: The name of the exchange used for the trade.

PLATFORM_EXCHANGE_VERSION.name: PLATFORM_EXCHANGE_VERSION
PLATFORM_EXCHANGE_VERSION.comment: The version of the exchange contract used for the transaction.

AGGREGATOR_NAME.name: AGGREGATOR_NAME
AGGREGATOR_NAME.comment: The name of the aggregator platform where the sale took place. If the sale did not take place via an aggregator platform, then the value will be null.

SELLER_ADDRESS.name: SELLER_ADDRESS
SELLER_ADDRESS.comment: The address of the seller of the NFT in the transaction.

BUYER_ADDRESS.name: BUYER_ADDRESS
BUYER_ADDRESS.comment: The address of the buyer of the NFT in the transaction.

NFT_ADDRESS.name: NFT_ADDRESS
NFT_ADDRESS.comment: The contract address of the NFT.

PROJECT_NAME.name: PROJECT_NAME
PROJECT_NAME.comment: The name of the NFT project. This field, along with metadata, will be filled in over time.

ERC1155_VALUE.name: ERC1155_VALUE
ERC1155_VALUE.comment: If the NFT is an ERC-1155 contract, this field may be one or greater, representing the number of tokens. If it is not an ERC-1155 token, this value will be null.

TOKENID.name: TOKENID
TOKENID.comment: The token ID for this NFT contract.

CURRENCY_SYMBOL.name: CURRENCY_SYMBOL
CURRENCY_SYMBOL.comment: The token symbol for this NFT event.

CURRENCY_ADDRESS.name: CURRENCY_ADDRESS
CURRENCY_ADDRESS.comment: The token contract address for this NFT event. This will be `ETH` for native ETH transactions.

PRICE.name: PRICE
PRICE.comment: The amount of the NFT event in the currency in which the transaction occurred, decimal adjusted where possible.

PRICE_USD.name: PRICE_USD
PRICE_USD.comment: The amount of the NFT event in US dollars. This will be 0 for tokens without a decimal adjustment or hourly price.

TOTAL_FEES.name: TOTAL_FEES
TOTAL_FEES.comment: The total amount of fees paid relating to the NFT purchase in the transaction currency. This includes royalty payments to creators and platform fees. Please note, this does not include the gas fee.

PLATFORM_FEE.name: PLATFORM_FEE
PLATFORM_FEE.comment: The decimal adjusted amount of fees paid to the platform for this NFT event in the transaction's currency.

CREATOR_FEE.name: CREATOR_FEE
CREATOR_FEE.comment: The decimal adjusted amount of fees paid to the NFT collection as royalty payments for this NFT event in the transaction's currency.

TOTAL_FEES_USD.name: TOTAL_FEES_USD
TOTAL_FEES_USD.comment: The total amount of fees paid relating to the NFT purchase in US dollars. This includes royalty payments to creators and platform fees. Please note, this does not include the gas fee.

PLATFORM_FEE_USD.name: PLATFORM_FEE_USD
PLATFORM_FEE_USD.comment: The amount of fees paid to the platform for this NFT event in US dollars.

CREATOR_FEE_USD.name: CREATOR_FEE_USD
CREATOR_FEE_USD.comment: The amount of fees paid to the NFT collection as royalty payments for this NFT event in US dollars.

TX_FEE.name: TX_FEE
TX_FEE.comment: The gas fee for this transaction in ETH.

TX_FEE_USD.name: TX_FEE_USD
TX_FEE_USD.comment: The gas fee for this transaction in US dollars.

ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS

metadata.name: EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY
metadata.comment: A convenience table that aggregates bridge activity from event_logs, traces and transfers, including bridge deposits and transfers sent from the following protocols: ACROSS, ALLBRIDGE, AXELAR, CELER, CBRIDGE, DLN, DEBRIDGE, EYWA, HOP, MESON, MULTICHAIN, NATIVE, STARGATE, SYMBIOSIS, SYNAPSE, WORMHOLE along with other helpful columns, including an amount USD where available. Note, this table only includes records for the protocols listed above with live, onchain bridge activity and may not represent the complete bridging picture.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block was produced.

ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The from address where the transaction originated from. This may be an EOA or contract address, however in most cases this is the user that initiated the bridge deposit or transfer.

ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.comment: The from address at the transaction level.

ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.name: ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.comment: The function signature of this transaction.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.

BRIDGE_ADDRESS.name: BRIDGE_ADDRESS
BRIDGE_ADDRESS.comment: The address of the contract responsible for handling the bridge deposit or transfer. This contract mediates the transfer and ensures that assets are sent and received appropriately.

EVENT_NAME.name: EVENT_NAME
EVENT_NAME.comment: The decoded event name for a given event.

PLATFORM.name: PLATFORM
PLATFORM.comment: The platform or protocol from which the bridge transaction or event originates.

SENDER.name: SENDER
SENDER.comment: The address that initiated the bridge deposit or transfer. This address is the sender of the tokens/assets being bridged to the destination chain. This may be an EOA or contract address.

RECEIVER.name: RECEIVER
RECEIVER.comment: The designated address set to receive the deposit or transfer. This may be an EOA or contract address.

DESTINATION_CHAIN_RECEIVER.name: DESTINATION_CHAIN_RECEIVER
DESTINATION_CHAIN_RECEIVER.comment: The designated address set to receive the bridged tokens on the target chain after the completion of the bridge transaction. For non-evm chains, the hex address is decoded/encoded to match the data format of the destination chain, where possible. This may be an EOA or contract address.

DESTINATION_CHAIN.name: DESTINATION_CHAIN
DESTINATION_CHAIN.comment: The name of the blockchain network to which the assets are being bridged. It could be any EVM compatible chain or other blockchain networks that the bridging protocol supports.

DESTINATION_CHAIN_ID.name: DESTINATION_CHAIN_ID
DESTINATION_CHAIN_ID.comment: The numeric identifier associated with the destination blockchain network. This is specific to the chain and helps in uniquely identifying it.

TOKEN_ADDRESS.name: TOKEN_ADDRESS
TOKEN_ADDRESS.comment: The address associated with the token that is being bridged. It provides a unique identifier for the token within its origin blockchain.

TOKEN_SYMBOL.name: TOKEN_SYMBOL
TOKEN_SYMBOL.comment: The symbol representing the token being bridged. This provides a shorthand representation of the token.

AMOUNT_UNADJ.name: AMOUNT_UNADJ
AMOUNT_UNADJ.comment: The raw, non-decimal adjusted amount of tokens involved in the bridge transaction.

AMOUNT.name: AMOUNT
AMOUNT.comment: The decimal adjusted amount of tokens involved in the bridge transaction, where available.

AMOUNT_USD.name: AMOUNT_USD
AMOUNT_USD.comment: The value of the bridged tokens in USD at the time of the bridge transaction, where available.

EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID.name: EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID
EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_REPAYMENTS
metadata.comment: This table contains transactions in which a borrower repays their loan (debt) across the AAVE, COMPOUND, CREAM, FLUX, FRAXLEND, RADIANT, SILO, SPARK, STRIKE, STURDY, and UWU protocols.  Loans are repaid in the same asset borrowed, plus accrued interest. Borrowers can pay back their loan based on the USD price as they can borrow any of the available stable coins (USDC, DAI, USDT, etc.).

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

CONTRACT_ADDRESS.comment: The address interacted with for a given event.

EVENT_NAME.comment: The decoded event name for a given event.

PLATFORM.comment: The specific protocol where lending event occurred.

PAYER.comment: The address that initiated the repayment.

BORROWER.comment: Address that initiated the borrow event.

PROTOCOL_MARKET.comment: The protocol's specific lending asset token, ie cWBTC or aETHUni.

TOKEN_ADDRESS.name: TOKEN_ADDRESS
TOKEN_ADDRESS.comment: The address of the token associated with the lending action.

TOKEN_SYMBOL.name: TOKEN_SYMBOL
TOKEN_SYMBOL.comment: The symbol of the token associated with the lending action.

AMOUNT_UNADJ.name: AMOUNT_UNADJ
AMOUNT_UNADJ.comment: The non-decimal adjusted amount of tokens involved in the lending transaction.

AMOUNT.name: AMOUNT
AMOUNT.comment: The decimal adjusted amount of tokens involved in the lending transaction, where available.

AMOUNT_USD.name: AMOUNT_USD
AMOUNT_USD.comment: The value of the tokens in USD at the time of the lending transaction, where available.

EZ_LENDING_REPAYMENTS_ID.name: EZ_LENDING_REPAYMENTS_ID
EZ_LENDING_REPAYMENTS_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_WITHDRAWS
metadata.comment: This table contains transactions in which a user withdraws liquidity across the AAVE, COMPOUND, CREAM, FLUX, FRAXLEND, RADIANT, SILO, SPARK, STRIKE, STURDY, and UWU protocols. Users need to make sure there is enough liquidity (not borrowed) in order to withdraw, if this is not the case, users need to wait for more liquidity from depositors or borrowers repaying.

ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS

PLATFORM.name: PLATFORM
PLATFORM.comment: The specific protocol where lending event occurred.

DEPOSITOR.comment: Its the address of the user who is Borrowing or repaying the loan, depending on the action.

PROTOCOL_MARKET.name: PROTOCOL_MARKET
PROTOCOL_MARKET.comment: The protocol's specific lending asset token, ie cWBTC or aETHUni.

TOKEN_ADDRESS.name: TOKEN_ADDRESS

metadata.name: EZ_ENS_DOMAINS
metadata.comment: A convenience table with up-to-date details pertaining to ENS domains registered onchain. Note, records are derived directly from onchain event logs only and may not be inclusive of off-chain activity.

LAST_REGISTERED_BLOCK.name: LAST_REGISTERED_BLOCK
LAST_REGISTERED_BLOCK.comment: The latest block number in which the domain was registered.

LAST_REGISTERED_TIMESTAMP.name: LAST_REGISTERED_TIMESTAMP
LAST_REGISTERED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The timestamp corresponding to the latest block in which the domain was registered.

LAST_REGISTERED_TX_HASH.name: LAST_REGISTERED_TX_HASH
LAST_REGISTERED_TX_HASH.comment: Transaction hash of the most recent domain registration event.

LAST_REGISTERED_CONTRACT.name: LAST_REGISTERED_CONTRACT
LAST_REGISTERED_CONTRACT.comment: The contract address responsible for the most recent domain registration.

MANAGER.name: MANAGER
MANAGER.comment: The address that currently manages the domain.

OWNER.name: OWNER
OWNER.comment: The address that currently owns the domain.

SET_ADDRESS.name: SET_ADDRESS
SET_ADDRESS.comment: The address that the domain currently resolves to.

ENS_SET.name: ENS_SET
ENS_SET.comment: Indicates if the domain has been set to an address.

ENS_SUBDOMAINS.name: ENS_SUBDOMAINS
ENS_SUBDOMAINS.comment: Any subdomains that are associated with the primary domain.

LABEL.name: LABEL
LABEL.comment: The label hash, which is a representation of the domain.

NODE.name: NODE
NODE.comment: A hash representing the ENS domain.

TOKEN_ID.name: TOKEN_ID
TOKEN_ID.comment: The ID of the token associated with the domain.

LAST_REGISTERED_COST.name: LAST_REGISTERED_COST
LAST_REGISTERED_COST.comment: The cost associated with the most recent registration of the domain.

LAST_REGISTERED_PREMIUM.name: LAST_REGISTERED_PREMIUM
LAST_REGISTERED_PREMIUM.comment: Any additional premium paid during the most recent registration of the domain.

RENEWAL_COST.name: RENEWAL_COST
RENEWAL_COST.comment: The cost to renew the domain's registration.

EXPIRATION_TIMESTAMP.name: EXPIRATION_TIMESTAMP
EXPIRATION_TIMESTAMP.comment: The timestamp at which the domain registration will expire.

EXPIRED.name: EXPIRED
EXPIRED.comment: Indicates if the domain registration has expired.

RESOLVER.name: RESOLVER
RESOLVER.comment: The address of the resolver contract that provides records for the domain.

PROFILE.name: PROFILE
PROFILE.comment: Profile information, such as avatars or social links, associated with the domain.

LAST_UPDATED.name: LAST_UPDATED
LAST_UPDATED.comment: The timestamp of the last update made to the domain's record or last updated record in this table.

EZ_ENS_DOMAINS_ID.name: EZ_ENS_DOMAINS_ID
EZ_ENS_DOMAINS_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_FLASHLOANS
metadata.comment: This table contains flash loan transactions across AAVE, RADIANT, SPARK, AND UWU protocols. Flash loans are a feature designed for developers, due to the technical knowledge required to execute one. Flash Loans allow you to borrow any available amount of assets without providing any collateral, as long as the liquidity is returned to the protocol within one block transaction.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP

CONTRACT_ADDRESS.comment: The address interacted with for a given event.

EVENT_NAME.comment: The decoded event name for a given event.

ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.comment: The function signature of this transaction.

ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The from address at the transaction level.

ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.comment: The to address at the transaction level.

PLATFORM.name: PLATFORM
PLATFORM.comment: The specific protocol where lending event occurred.

INITIATOR.name: INITIATOR
INITIATOR.comment: The address that initiated the flash loan.

TARGET.name: TARGET
TARGET.comment: The address receiving the flash loan.

PROTOCOL_MARKET.comment: The protocol's specific lending asset token, ie cWBTC or aETHUni.

FLASHLOAN_TOKEN_SYMBOL.comment: The symbol of the token associated with the lending action.

FLASHLOAN_AMOUNT_UNADJ.comment: The amount of assets flash loaned, non-decimal adjusted.

FLASHLOAN_AMOUNT.name: FLASHLOAN_AMOUNT
FLASHLOAN_AMOUNT.comment: The amount of assets flash loaned.

FLASHLOAN_AMOUNT_USD.name: FLASHLOAN_AMOUNT_USD
FLASHLOAN_AMOUNT_USD.comment: The value of the flash loan amount, in USD.

PREMIUM_AMOUNT_UNADJ.name: PREMIUM_AMOUNT_UNADJ
PREMIUM_AMOUNT_UNADJ.comment: The flash loan fee, changeable via the normal governance process, non-decimal adjusted.

PREMIUM_AMOUNT.name: PREMIUM_AMOUNT
PREMIUM_AMOUNT.comment: The flash loan fee, changeable via the normal governance process, decimal adjusted.

PREMIUM_AMOUNT_USD.name: PREMIUM_AMOUNT_USD

metadata.name: EZ_NFT_TRANSFERS
metadata.comment: This table contains NFT transfer events on the Ethereum blockchain.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The block timestamp at which the NFT event occurred.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: The block number at which the NFT event occurred.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: The transaction hash for the NFT event. This is not necessarily unique in this table as a transaction may contain multiple NFT events.

EVENT_INDEX.name: EVENT_INDEX
EVENT_INDEX.comment: The event number within a transaction

INTRA_EVENT_INDEX.name: INTRA_EVENT_INDEX
INTRA_EVENT_INDEX.comment: The order of events within a single event index. This is primarily used for ERC1155 NFT batch transfer events.

EVENT_TYPE.name: EVENT_TYPE
EVENT_TYPE.comment: The type of NFT event in this transaction, either `sale`,  `bid_won` or `redeem`.

NFT_ADDRESS.name: NFT_ADDRESS
NFT_ADDRESS.comment: The contract address of the NFT.

PROJECT_NAME.name: PROJECT_NAME
PROJECT_NAME.comment: The name of the NFT project. This field, along with metadata, will be filled in over time.

NFT_FROM_ADDRESS.name: NFT_FROM_ADDRESS
NFT_FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The sending address of the NFT in the transaction.

NFT_TO_ADDRESS.name: NFT_TO_ADDRESS
NFT_TO_ADDRESS.comment: The receiving address of the NFT in the transaction.

TOKENID.name: TOKENID
TOKENID.comment: The token ID for this NFT contract.

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_DEPOSITS
metadata.comment: This table contains deposit transactions across AAVE, EXACTLY, GRANARY, SONNE, and TAROT protocols. A user deposits their preferred asset and amount. After depositing, users earn passive income based on the market borrowing demand. Additionally, depositing allows users to borrow by using their deposited assets as a collateral. Any interest earned by depositing funds helps offset the interest rate accumulated by borrowing.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block was produced.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.

CONTRACT_ADDRESS.name: CONTRACT_ADDRESS
CONTRACT_ADDRESS.comment: The address interacted with for a given event.

EVENT_NAME.comment: The decoded event name for a given event.

ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.comment: The function signature of this transaction.

ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The from address of this transaction.

ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.comment: The to address of this transaction.

PLATFORM.name: PLATFORM
PLATFORM.comment: The specific protocol where lending event occurred.

PROTOCOL_MARKET.name: PROTOCOL_MARKET
PROTOCOL_MARKET.comment: The protocol's specific lending asset token, ie cWBTC or aETHUni.

DEPOSITOR.name: DEPOSITOR
DEPOSITOR.comment: Address that initiated a deposit event.

TOKEN_ADDRESS.name: TOKEN_ADDRESS
TOKEN_ADDRESS.comment: The address of the token associated with the lending action.

TOKEN_SYMBOL.comment: The symbol belonging to the address of the token

metadata.name: FACT_TRACES
metadata.comment: This table contains flattened trace data for internal contract calls on the Optimism Blockchain. Hex encoded fields can be decoded to integers by using `ethereum.ethereum.public.udf_hex_to_int()`.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: The transaction hash for the trace. Please note, this is not necessarily unique in this table as transactions frequently have multiple traces.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: The block number of this transaction.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The block timestamp of this transaction.

FROM_ADDRESS.name: FROM_ADDRESS
FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The sending address of this trace. This is not necessarily the from address of the transaction.

TO_ADDRESS.name: TO_ADDRESS
TO_ADDRESS.comment: The receiving address of this trace. This is not necessarily the to address of the transaction.

VALUE.name: VALUE
VALUE.comment: The amount of ETH transferred in this trace.

VALUE_PRECISE_RAW.name: VALUE_PRECISE_RAW
VALUE_PRECISE_RAW.comment: The precise, unadjusted amount of the transaction. This is returned as a string to avoid precision loss.

VALUE_PRECISE.name: VALUE_PRECISE
VALUE_PRECISE.comment: The precise, adjusted amount of the transaction. This is returned as a string to avoid precision loss.

GAS.name: GAS
GAS.comment: The gas supplied for this trace.

GAS_USED.name: GAS_USED
GAS_USED.comment: The gas used for this trace.

INPUT.name: INPUT
INPUT.comment: The input data for this trace.

OUTPUT.name: OUTPUT
OUTPUT.comment: The output data for this trace.

TYPE.name: TYPE
TYPE.comment: The type of internal transaction. Common trace types are `CALL`, `DELEGATECALL`, and `STATICCALL`.

IDENTIFIER.name: IDENTIFIER
IDENTIFIER.comment: This field represents the position and type of the trace within the transaction.

DATA.name: DATA
DATA.comment: The raw JSON data for this trace.

SUB_TRACES.name: SUB_TRACES
SUB_TRACES.comment: The amount of nested sub traces for this trace.

TRACE_STATUS.name: TRACE_STATUS
TRACE_STATUS.comment: The status of the trace, either `SUCCESS` or `FAIL`

ERROR_REASON.name: ERROR_REASON
ERROR_REASON.comment: The reason for the trace failure, if any.

TRACE_INDEX.name: TRACE_INDEX
TRACE_INDEX.comment: The index of the trace within the transaction.

FACT_TRACES_ID.name: FACT_TRACES_ID
FACT_TRACES_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

metadata.name: EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY
metadata.comment: A convenience table that aggregates bridge activity from event_logs, traces and transfers, including bridge deposits and transfers sent from the following protocols: ACROSS, AXELAR, CELER, CBRIDGE, DLN, DEBRIDGE, EYWA, HOP, MESON, MULTICHAIN, STARGATE, SYMBIOSIS, SYNAPSE, WORMHOLE along with other helpful columns, including an amount USD where available. Note, this table only includes records for the protocols listed above with live, onchain bridge activity and may not represent the complete bridging picture.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block was produced.

ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The from address where the transaction originated from. This may be an EOA or contract address, however in most cases this is the user that initiated the bridge deposit or transfer.

ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.comment: The from address of this transaction.

ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.name: ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.comment: The function signature of this transaction.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.

BRIDGE_ADDRESS.name: BRIDGE_ADDRESS
BRIDGE_ADDRESS.comment: The address of the contract responsible for handling the bridge deposit or transfer. This contract mediates the transfer and ensures that assets are sent and received appropriately.

EVENT_NAME.name: EVENT_NAME
EVENT_NAME.comment: The decoded event name for a given event.

PLATFORM.name: PLATFORM
PLATFORM.comment: The platform or protocol from which the bridge transaction or event originates.

SENDER.name: SENDER
SENDER.comment: The address that initiated the bridge deposit or transfer. This address is the sender of the tokens/assets being bridged to the destination chain. This may be an EOA or contract address.

RECEIVER.name: RECEIVER
RECEIVER.comment: The designated address set to receive the deposit or transfer. This may be an EOA or contract address.

DESTINATION_CHAIN_RECEIVER.name: DESTINATION_CHAIN_RECEIVER
DESTINATION_CHAIN_RECEIVER.comment: The designated address set to receive the bridged tokens on the target chain after the completion of the bridge transaction. For non-evm chains, the hex address is decoded/encoded to match the data format of the destination chain, where possible. This may be an EOA or contract address.

DESTINATION_CHAIN.name: DESTINATION_CHAIN
DESTINATION_CHAIN.comment: The name of the blockchain network to which the assets are being bridged. It could be any EVM compatible chain or other blockchain networks that the bridging protocol supports.

DESTINATION_CHAIN_ID.name: DESTINATION_CHAIN_ID
DESTINATION_CHAIN_ID.comment: The numeric identifier associated with the destination blockchain network. This is specific to the chain and helps in uniquely identifying it.

TOKEN_ADDRESS.name: TOKEN_ADDRESS
TOKEN_ADDRESS.comment: The address associated with the token that is being bridged. It provides a unique identifier for the token within its origin blockchain.

TOKEN_SYMBOL.name: TOKEN_SYMBOL
TOKEN_SYMBOL.comment: The symbol representing the token being bridged. This provides a shorthand representation of the token.

AMOUNT_UNADJ.name: AMOUNT_UNADJ
AMOUNT_UNADJ.comment: The raw, non-decimal adjusted amount of tokens involved in the bridge transaction.

AMOUNT.name: AMOUNT
AMOUNT.comment: The decimal adjusted amount of tokens involved in the bridge transaction, where available.

AMOUNT_USD.name: AMOUNT_USD
AMOUNT_USD.comment: The value of the bridged tokens in USD at the time of the bridge transaction, where available.

EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID.name: EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID
EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_REPAYMENTS
metadata.comment: This table contains transactions in which a borrower repays their loan (debt) across the AAVE, EXACTLY, GRANARY, SONNE, and TAROT protocols.  Loans are repaid in the same asset borrowed, plus accrued interest. Borrowers can pay back their loan based on the USD price as they can borrow any of the available stable coins (USDC, DAI, USDT, etc.).

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_LIQUIDATIONS
metadata.comment: This table contains transactions in which a borrower's collateral asset is liquidated across AAVE, EXACTLY, GRANARY, SONNE, and TAROT protocols. Liquidations occur when a borrower's health factor goes below 1 due to their collateral value not properly covering their loan/debt value. This might happen when the collateral decreases in value or the borrowed debt increases in value against each other. This collateral vs loan value ratio is shown in the health factor. In a liquidation, up to 50% of a borrower's debt is repaid and that value + liquidation fee is taken from the collateral available, so after a liquidation the amount liquidated from one's debt is repaid.

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_FLASHLOANS
metadata.comment: This table contains flash loan transactions across AAVE and GRANARY protocols. Flash loans are a feature designed for developers, due to the technical knowledge required to execute one. Flash Loans allow you to borrow any available amount of assets without providing any collateral, as long as the liquidity is returned to the protocol within one block transaction.

EVENT_NAME.comment: The decoded event name for a given event.

ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The from address of this transaction.

ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.comment: The to address of this transaction.

PREMIUM_AMOUNT_UNADJ.comment: The flash loan fee, changeable via the normal governance process, non-decimal adjusted.

metadata.name: EZ_DEX_SWAPS
metadata.comment:
This table currently contains swap events from the ```fact_event_logs``` table for SUSHI, UNISWAP, CURVE, SYNTHETIX, VELODROME, HASHFLOW, WOOFI, FRAX, KYBERSWAP and DODO along with other helpful columns including an amount USD where possible. Other dexes coming soon! 
Note: A rule has been put in place to null out the amount_USD if that number is too divergent between amount_in_USD and amount_out_usd. This can happen for swaps of less liquid tokens during very high fluctuation of price.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER

ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.comment: The to address of this transaction.

EVENT_NAME.comment: The decoded event name for a given event.

AMOUNT_IN.comment: The amount of tokens put into the swap.

AMOUNT_IN_USD.comment: The amount of tokens put into the swap converted to USD using the price of the token.

AMOUNT_OUT_UNADJ.comment: The non-decimal adjusted amount of tokens taken out of or received from the swap.

AMOUNT_OUT_USD.comment: The amount of tokens taken out of or received from the swap converted to USD using the price of the token.

metadata.name: EZ_SWAPS
metadata.comment: This table records asset swaps on the Flow blockchain.

TX_ID.name: TX_ID
TX_ID.comment: ID for the transaction.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time for when the block was written.

BLOCK_HEIGHT.name: BLOCK_HEIGHT
BLOCK_HEIGHT.comment: The block height the block was recorded at.

SWAP_CONTRACT.name: SWAP_CONTRACT
SWAP_CONTRACT.comment:
The smart contract address of the DEX swap pool.
Note for metapier swaps in the labels table - they all appear to use the same master contract `A.609e10301860b683.PierPair` so the `pool_id` is essential to differentiating what pool is used in the swap route.

SWAP_INDEX.name: SWAP_INDEX
SWAP_INDEX.comment: The positioning of the swap within a transaction. The first swap will index at 0. A swap transaction may only run through 1 pool, in which case the max index will be 0. A multi-pool swap that runs through 2 pools, for example, will have 2 records with swap index 0 and 1.

TRADER.name: TRADER
TRADER.comment: The account address of the trader performing the swap action.

TOKEN_OUT_SOURCE.name: TOKEN_OUT_SOURCE
TOKEN_OUT_SOURCE.comment: The source address of the token out in the swap record. If this is the first token withdraw in a swap, then the address is likely to be the trader. This could also be the address of a pool if this swap index is later in the transaction.

TOKEN_OUT_CONTRACT.name: TOKEN_OUT_CONTRACT
TOKEN_OUT_CONTRACT.comment:
The smart contract address for the token that is being swapped out of the traders wallet.
Token OUT / IN is from the perspective of the trader. So, an out token is leaving the wallet while the in token is being deposited to the wallet. This perspective is not changing for multi-pool trades - think of it directionally, the tokens continue flowing from out to in. Out of wallet, into pool, out of pool, into (another pool / wallet), with the final movement being tokens into final wallet.

TOKEN_OUT_AMOUNT.name: TOKEN_OUT_AMOUNT
TOKEN_OUT_AMOUNT.comment:
The amount of the token being swapped that the trader is sending to the pool (selling).
Token OUT / IN is from the perspective of the trader. So, an out token is leaving the wallet while the in token is being deposited to the wallet. This perspective is not changing for multi-pool trades - think of it directionally, the tokens continue flowing from out to in. Out of wallet, into pool, out of pool, into (another pool / wallet), with the final movement being tokens into final wallet.

TOKEN_IN_DESTINATION.name: TOKEN_IN_DESTINATION
TOKEN_IN_DESTINATION.comment: The destination address of the token in for the swap index. If this is the initial withdraw/deposit event interaction, it is likely to be the pool address for the swap. If this is the final destination for the token, this is likely to be the trader's address.

TOKEN_IN_CONTRACT.name: TOKEN_IN_CONTRACT
TOKEN_IN_CONTRACT.comment:
The smart contract address for the token that is being swapped into the traders wallet.
Token OUT / IN is from the perspective of the trader. So, an out token is leaving the wallet while the in token is being deposited to the wallet. This perspective is not changing for multi-pool trades - think of it directionally, the tokens continue flowing from out to in. Out of wallet, into pool, out of pool, into (another pool / wallet), with the final movement being tokens into final wallet.

TOKEN_IN_AMOUNT.name: TOKEN_IN_AMOUNT
TOKEN_IN_AMOUNT.comment:
The amount of the token being swapped that the trader is receiving from the pool (buying).
Token OUT / IN is from the perspective of the trader. So, an out token is leaving the wallet while the in token is being deposited to the wallet. This perspective is not changing for multi-pool trades - think of it directionally, the tokens continue flowing from out to in. Out of wallet, into pool, out of pool, into (another pool / wallet), with the final movement being tokens into final wallet.

EZ_SWAPS_ID.name: EZ_SWAPS_ID
EZ_SWAPS_ID.comment: A uniquely generated identifier assigned by a surrogate key

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The timestamp at which the record was initially created and inserted into this table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The timestamp at which this record was last modified by an internal process.

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_LIQUIDATIONS
metadata.comment: This table contains transactions in which a borrower's collateral asset is liquidated across DFORCE, KINZA, LIQEE, RADIANT, and VENUS protocols. Liquidations occur when a borrower's health factor goes below 1 due to their collateral value not properly covering their loan/debt value. This might happen when the collateral decreases in value or the borrowed debt increases in value against each other. This collateral vs loan value ratio is shown in the health factor. In a liquidation, up to 50% of a borrower's debt is repaid and that value + liquidation fee is taken from the collateral available, so after a liquidation the amount liquidated from one's debt is repaid.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block was produced.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.

CONTRACT_ADDRESS.name: CONTRACT_ADDRESS
CONTRACT_ADDRESS.comment: The address interacted with for a given event.

EVENT_NAME.name: EVENT_NAME
EVENT_NAME.comment: The decoded event name for a given event.

ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.name: ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.comment: The function signature of this transaction.

ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The from address of this transaction.

ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.comment: The to address of this transaction.

PLATFORM.name: PLATFORM
PLATFORM.comment: The specific protocol where lending event occurred.

LIQUIDATOR.name: LIQUIDATOR
LIQUIDATOR.comment: The address that initiated the liquidation call.

BORROWER.name: BORROWER
BORROWER.comment: Address that initiated the borrow event.

PROTOCOL_MARKET.name: PROTOCOL_MARKET
PROTOCOL_MARKET.comment: The protocol's specific lending asset token, ie cWBTC or aETHUni.

COLLATERAL_TOKEN.name: COLLATERAL_TOKEN
COLLATERAL_TOKEN.comment: The asset provided as collateral, which can be liquidated.

COLLATERAL_TOKEN_SYMBOL.name: COLLATERAL_TOKEN_SYMBOL
COLLATERAL_TOKEN_SYMBOL.comment: The symbol of the token associated with the lending action.

AMOUNT_UNADJ.name: AMOUNT_UNADJ
AMOUNT_UNADJ.comment: The non-decimal adjusted amount of tokens involved in the lending transaction.

AMOUNT.name: AMOUNT
AMOUNT.comment: The decimal adjusted amount of tokens involved in the lending transaction, where available.

AMOUNT_USD.name: AMOUNT_USD
AMOUNT_USD.comment: The value of the tokens in USD at the time of the lending transaction, where available.

DEBT_TOKEN.name: DEBT_TOKEN
DEBT_TOKEN.comment: The debt asset, which the user borrowed.

DEBT_TOKEN_SYMBOL.name: DEBT_TOKEN_SYMBOL
DEBT_TOKEN_SYMBOL.comment: The symbol belonging to the address of the token

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

metadata.name: FACT_TRACES
metadata.comment: This table contains flattened trace data for internal contract calls on the Binance Smart Chain. Hex encoded fields can be decoded to integers by using `ethereum.public.udf_hex_to_int()`.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: The transaction hash for the trace. Please note, this is not necessarily unique in this table as transactions frequently have multiple traces.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: The block number of this transaction.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The block timestamp of this transaction.

FROM_ADDRESS.name: FROM_ADDRESS
FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The sending address of this trace. This is not necessarily the from address of the transaction.

TO_ADDRESS.name: TO_ADDRESS
TO_ADDRESS.comment: The receiving address of this trace. This is not necessarily the to address of the transaction.

VALUE.name: VALUE
VALUE.comment: The amount of BNB transferred in this trace.

VALUE_PRECISE_RAW.name: VALUE_PRECISE_RAW
VALUE_PRECISE_RAW.comment: The precise, unadjusted amount of the transaction. This is returned as a string to avoid precision loss.

VALUE_PRECISE.name: VALUE_PRECISE
VALUE_PRECISE.comment: The precise, adjusted amount of the transaction. This is returned as a string to avoid precision loss.

GAS.name: GAS
GAS.comment: The gas supplied for this trace.

GAS_USED.name: GAS_USED
GAS_USED.comment: The gas used for this trace.

INPUT.name: INPUT
INPUT.comment: The input data for this trace.

OUTPUT.name: OUTPUT
OUTPUT.comment: The output data for this trace.

TYPE.name: TYPE
TYPE.comment: The type of internal transaction. Common trace types are `CALL`, `DELEGATECALL`, and `STATICCALL`.

IDENTIFIER.name: IDENTIFIER
IDENTIFIER.comment: This field represents the position and type of the trace within the transaction.

DATA.name: DATA
DATA.comment: The raw JSON data for this trace.

SUB_TRACES.name: SUB_TRACES
SUB_TRACES.comment: The amount of nested sub traces for this trace.

TRACE_STATUS.name: TRACE_STATUS
TRACE_STATUS.comment: The status of the trace, either `SUCCESS` or `FAIL`

ERROR_REASON.name: ERROR_REASON
ERROR_REASON.comment: The reason for the trace failure, if any.

TRACE_INDEX.name: TRACE_INDEX
TRACE_INDEX.comment: The index of the trace within the transaction.

FACT_TRACES_ID.name: FACT_TRACES_ID
FACT_TRACES_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_DEPOSITS
metadata.comment: This table contains deposit transactions across DFORCE, KINZA, LIQEE, RADIANT, and VENUS protocols. A user deposits their preferred asset and amount. After depositing, users earn passive income based on the market borrowing demand. Additionally, depositing allows users to borrow by using their deposited assets as a collateral. Any interest earned by depositing funds helps offset the interest rate accumulated by borrowing.

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_REPAYMENTS
metadata.comment: This table contains transactions in which a borrower repays their loan (debt) across the DFORCE, KINZA, LIQEE, RADIANT, and VENUS protocols.  Loans are repaid in the same asset borrowed, plus accrued interest. Borrowers can pay back their loan based on the USD price as they can borrow any of the available stable coins (USDC, DAI, USDT, etc.).

metadata.name: EZ_NATIVE_TRANSFERS
metadata.comment: This table contains all native BNB transfers, including equivalent USD amounts. The origin addresses correspond to the to and from addresses from the `fact_transactions` table. The `identifier` and `tx_hash` columns relate this table back to `fact_traces`, which contains more details on the transfers.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This will not be unique in this table as a transaction could include multiple transfer events.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block was produced.

TX_POSITION.name: TX_POSITION
TX_POSITION.comment: The position of the transaction within the block.

TRACE_INDEX.name: TRACE_INDEX
TRACE_INDEX.comment: The index of the trace within the transaction.

IDENTIFIER.name: IDENTIFIER
IDENTIFIER.comment: This field represents the position and type of the trace within the transaction.

ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The from address of this transaction.

ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.comment: The to address of this transaction.

ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.name: ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.comment: The function signature of this transaction.

FROM_ADDRESS.name: FROM_ADDRESS
FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The sending address of this transfer.

TO_ADDRESS.name: TO_ADDRESS
TO_ADDRESS.comment: The receiving address of this transfer. This can be a contract address.

AMOUNT.name: AMOUNT
AMOUNT.comment: ETH value transferred.

AMOUNT_PRECISE_RAW.name: AMOUNT_PRECISE_RAW
AMOUNT_PRECISE_RAW.comment: The precise, unadjusted amount of the transaction. This is returned as a string to avoid precision loss.

AMOUNT_PRECISE.name: AMOUNT_PRECISE
AMOUNT_PRECISE.comment: The precise, adjusted amount of the transaction. This is returned as a string to avoid precision loss.

AMOUNT_USD.name: AMOUNT_USD

metadata.name: EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY
metadata.comment: A convenience table that aggregates bridge activity from event_logs, traces and transfers, including bridge deposits and transfers sent from the following protocols: ALLBRIDGE, AXELAR, CELER, CBRIDGE, DLN, DEBRIDGE, EYWA, MESON, STARGATE, SYMBIOSIS, SYNAPSE, WORMHOLE along with other helpful columns, including an amount USD where available. Note, this table only includes records for the protocols listed above with live, onchain bridge activity and may not represent the complete bridging picture.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block was produced.

ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The from address where the transaction originated from. This may be an EOA or contract address, however in most cases this is the user that initiated the bridge deposit or transfer.

ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.comment: The from address of this transaction.

ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.name: ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.comment: The function signature of this transaction.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.

BRIDGE_ADDRESS.name: BRIDGE_ADDRESS
BRIDGE_ADDRESS.comment: The address of the contract responsible for handling the bridge deposit or transfer. This contract mediates the transfer and ensures that assets are sent and received appropriately.

EVENT_NAME.name: EVENT_NAME
EVENT_NAME.comment: The decoded event name for a given event.

PLATFORM.name: PLATFORM
PLATFORM.comment: The platform or protocol from which the bridge transaction or event originates.

SENDER.name: SENDER
SENDER.comment: The address that initiated the bridge deposit or transfer. This address is the sender of the tokens/assets being bridged to the destination chain. This may be an EOA or contract address.

RECEIVER.name: RECEIVER
RECEIVER.comment: The designated address set to receive the deposit or transfer. This may be an EOA or contract address.

DESTINATION_CHAIN_RECEIVER.name: DESTINATION_CHAIN_RECEIVER
DESTINATION_CHAIN_RECEIVER.comment: The designated address set to receive the bridged tokens on the target chain after the completion of the bridge transaction. For non-evm chains, the hex address is decoded/encoded to match the data format of the destination chain, where possible. This may be an EOA or contract address.

DESTINATION_CHAIN.name: DESTINATION_CHAIN
DESTINATION_CHAIN.comment: The name of the blockchain network to which the assets are being bridged. It could be any EVM compatible chain or other blockchain networks that the bridging protocol supports.

DESTINATION_CHAIN_ID.name: DESTINATION_CHAIN_ID
DESTINATION_CHAIN_ID.comment: The numeric identifier associated with the destination blockchain network. This is specific to the chain and helps in uniquely identifying it.

TOKEN_ADDRESS.name: TOKEN_ADDRESS
TOKEN_ADDRESS.comment: The address associated with the token that is being bridged. It provides a unique identifier for the token within its origin blockchain.

TOKEN_SYMBOL.name: TOKEN_SYMBOL
TOKEN_SYMBOL.comment: The symbol representing the token being bridged. This provides a shorthand representation of the token.

AMOUNT_UNADJ.name: AMOUNT_UNADJ
AMOUNT_UNADJ.comment: The raw, non-decimal adjusted amount of tokens involved in the bridge transaction.

AMOUNT.name: AMOUNT
AMOUNT.comment: The decimal adjusted amount of tokens involved in the bridge transaction, where available.

AMOUNT_USD.name: AMOUNT_USD
AMOUNT_USD.comment: The value of the bridged tokens in USD at the time of the bridge transaction, where available.

EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID.name: EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID
EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: EZ_CORE_METRICS_HOURLY
metadata.comment: A convenience table that aggregates block and transaction related metrics using various aggregate functions such as SUM, COUNT, MIN and MAX from the fact_transactions table, on an hourly basis.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP_HOUR.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP_HOUR
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP_HOUR.comment: The hour of the timestamp of the block.

BLOCK_NUMBER_MIN.name: BLOCK_NUMBER_MIN
BLOCK_NUMBER_MIN.comment: The minimum block number in the hour.

BLOCK_NUMBER_MAX.name: BLOCK_NUMBER_MAX
BLOCK_NUMBER_MAX.comment: The maximum block number in the hour.

BLOCK_COUNT.name: BLOCK_COUNT
BLOCK_COUNT.comment: The number of blocks in the hour.

TRANSACTION_COUNT.name: TRANSACTION_COUNT
TRANSACTION_COUNT.comment: The number of transactions in the hour.

TRANSACTION_COUNT_SUCCESS.name: TRANSACTION_COUNT_SUCCESS
TRANSACTION_COUNT_SUCCESS.comment: The number of successful transactions in the hour.

TRANSACTION_COUNT_FAILED.name: TRANSACTION_COUNT_FAILED
TRANSACTION_COUNT_FAILED.comment: The number of failed transactions in the hour.

UNIQUE_FROM_COUNT.name: UNIQUE_FROM_COUNT
UNIQUE_FROM_COUNT.comment: The number of unique origin from addresses in the hour.

UNIQUE_TO_COUNT.name: UNIQUE_TO_COUNT
UNIQUE_TO_COUNT.comment: The number of unique origin to addresses in the hour.

TOTAL_FEES_NATIVE.name: TOTAL_FEES_NATIVE
TOTAL_FEES_NATIVE.comment: The sum of all fees in the hour, in the native fee currency. Note, Snowflake's native SUM() function may limit decimal precision. To view precise transaction fee values, please use the `tx_fee_precise` column in `core.fact_transactions`.

TOTAL_FEES_USD.name: TOTAL_FEES_USD
TOTAL_FEES_USD.comment: The sum of all fees in the hour, in USD, rounded to 2 decimal places.

EZ_CORE_METRICS_HOURLY_ID.name: EZ_CORE_METRICS_HOURLY_ID
EZ_CORE_METRICS_HOURLY_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_FLASHLOANS
metadata.comment: This table contains flash loan transactions across KINZA and RADIANT protocols. Flash loans are a feature designed for developers, due to the technical knowledge required to execute one. Flash Loans allow you to borrow any available amount of assets without providing any collateral, as long as the liquidity is returned to the protocol within one block transaction.

ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.comment: The to address of this transaction.

FLASHLOAN_AMOUNT_USD.comment: The value of the flash loan amount, in USD.

PREMIUM_AMOUNT_UNADJ.comment: The flash loan fee, changeable via the normal governance process, non-decimal adjusted.

PREMIUM_AMOUNT.comment: The flash loan fee, changeable via the normal governance process, decimal adjusted.

PREMIUM_AMOUNT_USD.name: PREMIUM_AMOUNT_USD
PREMIUM_AMOUNT_USD.comment: The flash loan fee, valued in USD.

metadata.name: EZ_DEX_SWAPS
metadata.comment:
This table currently contains swap events from the ```fact_event_logs``` table for TRADER JOE, WOOFI, KYBERSWAP, PANCAKE SWAP, LEVEL, BISWAP, DODO, FRAX, HASHFLOW, UNISWAP and SUSHI along with other helpful columns including an amount USD where possible. Other dexes coming soon! 
Note: A rule has been put in place to null out the amount_USD if that number is too divergent between amount_in_USD and amount_out_usd. This can happen for swaps of less liquid tokens during very high fluctuation of price.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block was produced.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.

ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.comment: The function signature of the contract call.

ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The from address of this transaction.

ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.comment: The to address of this transaction.

CONTRACT_ADDRESS.name: CONTRACT_ADDRESS
CONTRACT_ADDRESS.comment: The address interacted with for a given event.

EVENT_NAME.name: EVENT_NAME
EVENT_NAME.comment: The decoded event name for a given event.

AMOUNT_IN_UNADJ.name: AMOUNT_IN_UNADJ
AMOUNT_IN_UNADJ.comment: The non-decimal adjusted amount of tokens put into the swap.

AMOUNT_IN.name: AMOUNT_IN
AMOUNT_IN.comment: The amount of tokens put into the swap.

AMOUNT_IN_USD.name: AMOUNT_IN_USD
AMOUNT_IN_USD.comment: The amount of tokens put into the swap converted to USD using the price of the token.

AMOUNT_OUT_UNADJ.name: AMOUNT_OUT_UNADJ
AMOUNT_OUT_UNADJ.comment: The non-decimal adjusted amount of tokens taken out of or received from the swap.

AMOUNT_OUT.name: AMOUNT_OUT
AMOUNT_OUT.comment: The amount of tokens taken out of or received from the swap.

AMOUNT_OUT_USD.name: AMOUNT_OUT_USD
AMOUNT_OUT_USD.comment: The amount of tokens taken out of or received from the swap converted to USD using the price of the token.

SENDER.name: SENDER
SENDER.comment: The Router is the Sender in the swap function.

TX_TO.name: TX_TO
TX_TO.comment: The tx_to is the address who receives the swapped token. This corresponds to the "to" field in the swap function.

PLATFORM.name: PLATFORM
PLATFORM.comment: The protocol or platform that the liquidity pool belongs to or swap occurred on.

TOKEN_IN.name: TOKEN_IN
TOKEN_IN.comment: The address of the token sent for swap.

TOKEN_OUT.name: TOKEN_OUT
TOKEN_OUT.comment: The address of the token being swapped to.

SYMBOL_IN.name: SYMBOL_IN
SYMBOL_IN.comment: The symbol of the token sent for swap.

SYMBOL_OUT.name: SYMBOL_OUT
SYMBOL_OUT.comment: The symbol of the token being swapped to.

_LOG_ID.name: _LOG_ID
_LOG_ID.comment: Deprecated. This column is no longer used. Please remove from your query by Jan. 31 2024.'

metadata.name: EZ_DEX_SWAPS
metadata.comment: DEX Swaps on the NEAR blockchain, with label and price data joined in for ease of use (where available). Note - view updated February 2024 to use the same v2 Swaps model as fact_dex_swaps. TOKEN_IN and TOKEN_OUT are now SYMBOL_IN/OUT. POOL ID is found in the SWAP_INPUT_DATA, where available.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: Unique identifier (hash) of this transaction.

BLOCK_ID.name: BLOCK_ID
BLOCK_ID.comment: The height of the chain this block corresponds with.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block began.

PLATFORM.name: PLATFORM
PLATFORM.comment: The protocol utilized for the operation, likely a swap or bridge.

POOL_ID.name: POOL_ID
POOL_ID.comment: The unique id for the pool involved in the swap.

TRADER.name: TRADER
TRADER.comment: The address who initiated the swap.

SWAP_INDEX.name: SWAP_INDEX
SWAP_INDEX.comment: The index number of the swap indicating its order of execution in the transaction.

AMOUNT_OUT_RAW.name: AMOUNT_OUT_RAW
AMOUNT_OUT_RAW.comment: An unadjusted amount (of tokens, price, etc.) for the relevant record. This is the number as it appears on chain and is not decimal adjusted.

AMOUNT_OUT.name: AMOUNT_OUT
AMOUNT_OUT.comment: The amount of tokens taken out of or received from the swap.

AMOUNT_OUT_USD.name: AMOUNT_OUT_USD
AMOUNT_OUT_USD.comment: Token amount for the record decimal adjusted and multiplied by a price in USD, if available.

TOKEN_OUT_CONTRACT.name: TOKEN_OUT_CONTRACT
TOKEN_OUT_CONTRACT.comment: The address of the deployed contract for the token, nft, or other smart contract.

SYMBOL_OUT.name: SYMBOL_OUT
SYMBOL_OUT.comment: The shorthand symbol for the token, as used by common price feeds and exchanges.

AMOUNT_IN_RAW.name: AMOUNT_IN_RAW
AMOUNT_IN_RAW.comment: An unadjusted amount (of tokens, price, etc.) for the relevant record. This is the number as it appears on chain and is not decimal adjusted.

AMOUNT_IN.name: AMOUNT_IN
AMOUNT_IN.comment: The amount of tokens put into the swap.

AMOUNT_IN_USD.name: AMOUNT_IN_USD
AMOUNT_IN_USD.comment: Token amount for the record decimal adjusted and multiplied by a price in USD, if available.

TOKEN_IN_CONTRACT.name: TOKEN_IN_CONTRACT
TOKEN_IN_CONTRACT.comment: The address of the deployed contract for the token, nft, or other smart contract.

SYMBOL_IN.name: SYMBOL_IN
SYMBOL_IN.comment: The shorthand symbol for the token, as used by common price feeds and exchanges.

SWAP_INPUT_DATA.name: SWAP_INPUT_DATA
SWAP_INPUT_DATA.comment:
JSON of input data for the swap, taken from the FunctionCall JSON.
Note, directional keys such as in and out are determined by the pool.

LOG.name: LOG
LOG.comment: A single log extracted from a receipt.

EZ_DEX_SWAPS_ID.name: EZ_DEX_SWAPS_ID
EZ_DEX_SWAPS_ID.comment: A unique identifier for the record.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The timestamp at which the record was initially created and inserted into this table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The timestamp at which this record was last modified by an internal process.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: LOGS_S3
metadata.comment: This table extracts all logs from receipts and decodes the arguments for easy use.

BLOCK_ID.name: BLOCK_ID
BLOCK_ID.comment: The height of the chain this block corresponds with.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block began.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: Unique identifier (hash) of this transaction.

RECEIPT_OBJECT_ID.name: RECEIPT_OBJECT_ID
RECEIPT_OBJECT_ID.comment: Unique identifier of the receipt object for this transaction.

LOG_ID.name: LOG_ID
LOG_ID.comment: Concatenation between receipt id and index of the log.

LOG_INDEX.name: LOG_INDEX
LOG_INDEX.comment: The positon index for the record in question, if it was stored in a particular order.

RECEIVER_ID.name: RECEIVER_ID
RECEIVER_ID.comment:
The address of the NEAR account that the receipt was executed on.
Note, this differs from `tx_receiver` and is associated with the receipt within a transaction. It is often a contract on which a method is executed by the `signer_id`.

PREDECESSOR_ID.name: PREDECESSOR_ID
PREDECESSOR_ID.comment:
This is the account that was the immediate caller to the smart contract. If this is a simple transaction (no cross-contract calls) from alice.near to banana.near, the smart contract at banana.near considers Alice the predecessor. In this case, Alice would also be the signer.  
  
Source: https://docs.near.org/tutorials/crosswords/beginner/actions#predecessor-signer-and-current-account

SIGNER_ID.name: SIGNER_ID
SIGNER_ID.comment: The signer is the account that originally signed the transaction that began the blockchain activity, which may or may not include cross-contract calls. If a function calls results in several cross-contract calls, think of the signer as the account that pushed over the first domino in that chain reaction.

CLEAN_LOG.name: CLEAN_LOG
CLEAN_LOG.comment: The logs linked to the transaction.

IS_STANDARD.name: IS_STANDARD
IS_STANDARD.comment: A boolean value indicating whether it is a standardized log or not.

GAS_BURNT.name: GAS_BURNT
GAS_BURNT.comment:
The gas used in the object, whether it be the transaction, action or receipt. In the case of a curated model where this column is included alongside a transaction fee, this is the gas burnt during the individual action or receipt.

In raw number format with 16 decimal places, to adjust divide by POW(10,16) or multiply by 1e-16.

RECEIPT_SUCCEEDED.name: RECEIPT_SUCCEEDED
RECEIPT_SUCCEEDED.comment: A boolean indicating whether the receipt was successfully processed, based on the presence of a Failure message.

_PARTITION_BY_BLOCK_NUMBER.name: _PARTITION_BY_BLOCK_NUMBER
_PARTITION_BY_BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Block number grouping for ingestion partition

_INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: _INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
_INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The timestamp for when the block was inserted into the data warehouse by the Chainwalker.

_MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: _MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
_MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment:
The timestamp at which the underlying record was last modified by an internal process.
This is used for incrementally loading based on when the source data was last modified.

LOGS_ID.name: LOGS_ID
LOGS_ID.comment: A unique identifier for the record.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The timestamp at which the record was initially created and inserted into this table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The timestamp at which this record was last modified by an internal process.

_INVOCATION_ID.name: _INVOCATION_ID
_INVOCATION_ID.comment: A job ID to identify the run that last modified a record.

If a function calls results in several cross-contract calls, think of the signer as the account that pushed over the first domino in that chain reaction.

SWAP_INDEX.name: SWAP_INDEX

metadata.name: EZ_CORE_METRICS_HOURLY
metadata.comment: A convenience table that aggregates block and transaction related metrics using various aggregate functions such as SUM, COUNT, MIN and MAX from the fact_transactions table, on an hourly basis. Stats for the current hour will be updated as new data arrives.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP_HOUR.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP_HOUR
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP_HOUR.comment: The hour of the timestamp of the block.

BLOCK_NUMBER_MIN.name: BLOCK_NUMBER_MIN
BLOCK_NUMBER_MIN.comment: The minimum block number in the hour.

BLOCK_NUMBER_MAX.name: BLOCK_NUMBER_MAX
BLOCK_NUMBER_MAX.comment: The maximum block number in the hour.

BLOCK_COUNT.name: BLOCK_COUNT
BLOCK_COUNT.comment: The number of blocks in the hour.

TRANSACTION_COUNT.name: TRANSACTION_COUNT
TRANSACTION_COUNT.comment: The number of transactions in the hour.

TRANSACTION_COUNT_SUCCESS.name: TRANSACTION_COUNT_SUCCESS
TRANSACTION_COUNT_SUCCESS.comment: The number of successful transactions in the hour.

TRANSACTION_COUNT_FAILED.name: TRANSACTION_COUNT_FAILED
TRANSACTION_COUNT_FAILED.comment: The number of failed transactions in the hour.

UNIQUE_FROM_COUNT.name: UNIQUE_FROM_COUNT
UNIQUE_FROM_COUNT.comment: The number of unique origin from addresses in the hour.

UNIQUE_TO_COUNT.name: UNIQUE_TO_COUNT
UNIQUE_TO_COUNT.comment: The number of unique origin to addresses in the hour.

TOTAL_FEES_NATIVE.name: TOTAL_FEES_NATIVE
TOTAL_FEES_NATIVE.comment: The sum of all fees in the hour, in the native fee currency.

TOTAL_FEES_USD.name: TOTAL_FEES_USD
TOTAL_FEES_USD.comment: The sum of all fees in the hour, in USD.

EZ_CORE_METRICS_HOURLY_ID.name: EZ_CORE_METRICS_HOURLY_ID
EZ_CORE_METRICS_HOURLY_ID.comment: A unique identifier for the record.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The timestamp at which the record was initially created and inserted into this table.

metadata.name: EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY
metadata.comment: Modeled bridge activity, tracking tokens through the NEAR Ecosystem. Token labels and USD Price appended to record, where available.

BLOCK_ID.name: BLOCK_ID
BLOCK_ID.comment: The height of the chain this block corresponds with.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block began.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: Unique identifier (hash) of this transaction.

TOKEN_ADDRESS.name: TOKEN_ADDRESS
TOKEN_ADDRESS.comment: The contract address corresponding to the token, view details of the contract by following this address on the chain explorer.

AMOUNT_UNADJ.name: AMOUNT_UNADJ
AMOUNT_UNADJ.comment: An unadjusted amount (of tokens, price, etc.) for the relevant record. This is the number as it appears on chain and is not decimal adjusted.

AMOUNT_ADJ.name: AMOUNT_ADJ
AMOUNT_ADJ.comment: A decimal adjusted amount (of tokens, price, etc.).

SYMBOL.name: SYMBOL
SYMBOL.comment: The shorthand symbol for the token, as used by common price feeds and exchanges.

AMOUNT.name: AMOUNT
AMOUNT.comment:
The amount of tokens transferred
If in the ez_ view, this number is decimal adjusted to actual amount. If in silver level or a fact_ view, the raw amount is presented

AMOUNT_USD.name: AMOUNT_USD
AMOUNT_USD.comment: Token amount for the record decimal adjusted and multiplied by a price in USD, if available.

DESTINATION_ADDRESS.name: DESTINATION_ADDRESS
DESTINATION_ADDRESS.comment: The address tokens are being sent to, in a transfer or bridge transaction.

SOURCE_ADDRESS.name: SOURCE_ADDRESS
SOURCE_ADDRESS.comment:
The originating address from which tokens are being sent, in a transfer or bridge transaction.  

This addressed is ascertained as best as possible, but may be null depending on the available information.  

Example 1 - tx CzPRdoiU74bo9yqqt9fCP5Xdab2mPVqxr9gU5xeaQA4a stores just "signer_public_key 0x0x1589…f694" on chain.  

Example 2 - tx FA7tQeGQnhminbas28YgaizwmT4vnEUiCr3vdXmN3Xjn does not log any signing address at all.

PLATFORM.name: PLATFORM
PLATFORM.comment: The protocol utilized for the operation, likely a swap or bridge.

BRIDGE_ADDRESS.name: BRIDGE_ADDRESS
BRIDGE_ADDRESS.comment: The address of the deployed contract for the token, nft, or other smart contract.

DESTINATION_CHAIN.name: DESTINATION_CHAIN
DESTINATION_CHAIN.comment: The recipient blockchain in a bridge transaction.

SOURCE_CHAIN.name: SOURCE_CHAIN
SOURCE_CHAIN.comment: The originating blockchain in a bridge transaction.

METHOD_NAME.name: METHOD_NAME
METHOD_NAME.comment: Name of the method(s) approved for use. NULL if permission is FullAccess.

DIRECTION.name: DIRECTION
DIRECTION.comment:
Direction of funds through a bridge. Inbound = tokens bridged to Near ecosystem.

Note - for the Rainbow bridge, inbound means Near or Aurora as tokens pass through Near to get to Aurora.

RECEIPT_SUCCEEDED.name: RECEIPT_SUCCEEDED
RECEIPT_SUCCEEDED.comment: A boolean indicating whether the receipt was successfully processed, based on the presence of a Failure message.

EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID.name: EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID
EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID.comment: A unique identifier for the record.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The timestamp at which the record was initially created and inserted into this table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The timestamp at which this record was last modified by an internal process.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table
