BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block began.

ACTION_ID.name: ACTION_ID
ACTION_ID.comment: The `action_id` is a concatenation of `receipt_id `and the index of the action within a receipt. This is unique for each record. The primary hash depends on the source of the action, as both a transaction and a receipt can process actions.

DEPOSIT.name: DEPOSIT
DEPOSIT.comment:
Sum of all NEAR tokens transferred from the signing account to the receiver account during receipt processing. This includes tokens sent in a Transfer action(s), and tokens sent in a FunctionCall action(s) with a deposit attached.

In raw number format with 24 decimal places, to adjust divide by POW(10,24) or multiply by 1e-24.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: Unique identifier (hash) of this transaction.

SIGNER_ID.name: SIGNER_ID
SIGNER_ID.comment: The signer is the account that originally signed the transaction that began the blockchain activity, which may or may not include cross-contract calls. If a function calls results in several cross-contract calls, think of the signer as the account that pushed over the first domino in that chain reaction.

RECEIVER_ID.name: RECEIVER_ID
RECEIVER_ID.comment:
The address of the NEAR account that the receipt was executed on.
Note, this differs from `tx_receiver` and is associated with the receipt within a transaction. It is often a contract on which a method is executed by the `signer_id`.

TRANSACTION_FEE.name: TRANSACTION_FEE
TRANSACTION_FEE.comment:
Total fee paid in NEAR to execute this transaction, which is a summation of all fees paid for actions and receipts within the transaction.

In raw number format, to adjust divide by POW(10,24)

GAS_USED.name: GAS_USED
GAS_USED.comment: Units of gas required to execute this transaction. In raw number format, to adjust divide by POW(10,12)

TX_SUCCEEDED.name: TX_SUCCEEDED
TX_SUCCEEDED.comment: Indicates whether the transaction failed or succeeded.

RECEIPT_SUCCEEDED.name: RECEIPT_SUCCEEDED
RECEIPT_SUCCEEDED.comment: A boolean indicating whether the receipt was successfully processed, based on the presence of a Failure message.

STATUS.name: STATUS
STATUS.comment:
Boolean representing the success or failure of the event.
For transfers, both the tx and receipt must have succeeded for STATUS to be TRUE. 

NOTE - it is possible for a transaction to successfully execute while one of its receipts fails. A transaction can also be a failure with successful receipts. It is possible the approach taken to determine a successful transfer is incorrect, so both tx and receipt success fields are available.

FACT_TRANSFERS_ID.name: FACT_TRANSFERS_ID
FACT_TRANSFERS_ID.comment: A unique identifier for the record.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The timestamp at which the record was initially created and inserted into this table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The timestamp at which this record was last modified by an internal process.

TOTAL_FEES_USD.name: TOTAL_FEES_USD
TOTAL_FEES_USD.comment: The sum of all fees in the hour, in USD.

metadata.name: EZ_CORE_METRICS_HOURLY
metadata.comment: A convenience table that aggregates block and transaction related metrics using various aggregate functions such as SUM, COUNT, MIN and MAX from the fact_transactions table, on an hourly basis. Stats for the current hour will be updated as new data arrives.

BLOCK_NUMBER_MIN.comment: The minimum block number in the hour.

BLOCK_NUMBER_MAX.comment: The maximum block number in the hour.

BLOCK_COUNT.name: BLOCK_COUNT
BLOCK_COUNT.comment: The number of blocks in the hour.

TRANSACTION_COUNT.name: TRANSACTION_COUNT
TRANSACTION_COUNT.comment: The number of transactions in the hour.

TRANSACTION_COUNT_SUCCESS.comment: The number of successful transactions in the hour.

TRANSACTION_COUNT_FAILED.name: TRANSACTION_COUNT_FAILED
TRANSACTION_COUNT_FAILED.comment: The number of failed transactions in the hour.

UNIQUE_SIGNERS_COUNT.name: UNIQUE_SIGNERS_COUNT
UNIQUE_SIGNERS_COUNT.comment: The count of unique first signers for transactions in the hour.

TOTAL_FEES_NATIVE.name: TOTAL_FEES_NATIVE
TOTAL_FEES_NATIVE.comment: The sum of all fees in the hour, in Lamports.

TOTAL_FEES_USD.name: TOTAL_FEES_USD
TOTAL_FEES_USD.comment: The sum of all fees in the hour, in USD.

EZ_CORE_METRICS_HOURLY_ID.name: EZ_CORE_METRICS_HOURLY_ID
EZ_CORE_METRICS_HOURLY_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The timestamp at which this record was last modified by an internal process.

metadata.name: FACT_SWAPS
metadata.comment: This table contains swaps performed on Jupiter, Orca, Raydium, Saber, Bonkswap, Dooar, Phoenix and Meteora swap programs. Intermediate swaps are aggregated over the DEX programs, so the values showcase the final mint/amount swap values. Ie. a swap on Jupiter that swaps SOL->USDC->mSOL->ETH would show the initial amount in and the final amount out of SOL->ETH. For Phoenix, we are not capturing swaps where there are separate transactions for placing the order and filling the order.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block began.

BLOCK_ID.name: BLOCK_ID
BLOCK_ID.comment: Slot for which a block can be created.

TX_ID.name: TX_ID
TX_ID.comment: A unique key that identifies a transaction

SUCCEEDED.name: SUCCEEDED
SUCCEEDED.comment: True when a transaction is successful, otherwise false.

SWAP_FROM_AMOUNT.name: SWAP_FROM_AMOUNT
SWAP_FROM_AMOUNT.comment: Total amount of the token sent in to initiate the swap

SWAP_FROM_MINT.name: SWAP_FROM_MINT
SWAP_FROM_MINT.comment: Token being sent or swapped from

SWAP_TO_AMOUNT.name: SWAP_TO_AMOUNT
SWAP_TO_AMOUNT.comment: Total amount of the token received in the swap

SWAP_TO_MINT.name: SWAP_TO_MINT
SWAP_TO_MINT.comment: Token being received or swapped for

PROGRAM_ID.name: PROGRAM_ID
PROGRAM_ID.comment: Token being received or swapped for

SWAP_PROGRAM.name: SWAP_PROGRAM
SWAP_PROGRAM.comment: name of decentralized exchange used to perform the swap

_LOG_ID.name: _LOG_ID
_LOG_ID.comment: Combination of TX_ID and event index

FACT_SWAPS_ID.name: FACT_SWAPS_ID
FACT_SWAPS_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

metadata.name: FACT_TRANSACTIONS
metadata.comment: Records of all transactions that have occurred on Axelar, dating back to the genesis block.

BLOCK_ID.name: BLOCK_ID
BLOCK_ID.comment: The block height the block was recorded at.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block began.

TX_ID.name: TX_ID
TX_ID.comment: A unique key that identifies a transaction. Called "TxHash" on block explorers.

TX_FROM.name: TX_FROM
TX_FROM.comment: The wallet address of the individual who initiated the transaction

TX_SUCCEEDED.name: TX_SUCCEEDED
TX_SUCCEEDED.comment: Transaction status is "TRUE" if the transaction went through, "FALSE" if the transaction failed.

FEE.name: FEE
FEE.comment: The fee is paid by the initiator of the transaction. Fee = gas * gas price and is given in micro-AXL.

FEE_DENOM.name: FEE_DENOM
FEE_DENOM.comment: The denominator of the transaction fee.

GAS_USED.name: GAS_USED
GAS_USED.comment: The amount of gas consumed by the transaction.

GAS_WANTED.name: GAS_WANTED
GAS_WANTED.comment: Amount of gas requested for a transaction. It is provided by users when the transaction is generated.

TX_CODE.name: TX_CODE
TX_CODE.comment: A number that corresponds to various error codes. When "0", the transaction is successful. Non-zero numbers signify different types of transaction failures.

TX_LOG.name: TX_LOG
TX_LOG.comment: A string that contains the transaction logs, which are logs written by the program interacted with during the transaction.

MSGS.name: MSGS
MSGS.comment: The underlying json from the messages or events within the transactions

FACT_TRANSACTIONS_ID.name: FACT_TRANSACTIONS_ID
FACT_TRANSACTIONS_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP

TX_SUCCEEDED.comment: Transaction status is "TRUE" if the transaction went through, "FALSE" if the transaction failed.

TRANSFER_TYPE.name: TRANSFER_TYPE
TRANSFER_TYPE.comment: Details on the type of transfer occurring during the transaction. "Transfer_In" = depositing tokens onto Axelar. "Transfer_out" = withdrawing tokens from Axelar. "Axelar" = wallet to wallet transfer on Axelar.

SENDER.name: SENDER
SENDER.comment: The wallet address of the individual sent tokens in the transfer.

AMOUNT.name: AMOUNT

CURRENCY.name: CURRENCY
CURRENCY.comment: The currency that was used in the transaction message.

DECIMAL.name: DECIMAL
DECIMAL.comment: Divide the raw amount of currency as provided in the amount column by the decimal to get the actual amount in AXL or other currency.

RECEIVER.name: RECEIVER
RECEIVER.comment: The wallet address of the individual received tokens in the transfer.

FOREIGN_ADDRESS.name: FOREIGN_ADDRESS
FOREIGN_ADDRESS.comment: The foreign address of the transfer if exists. This can be an IBC address or other non-IBC address

FOREIGN_CHAIN.name: FOREIGN_CHAIN
FOREIGN_CHAIN.comment: The name of the foreign chain transfer if exists

FACT_TRANSFERS_ID.name: FACT_TRANSFERS_ID
FACT_TRANSFERS_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

metadata.name: FACT_TRANSACTIONS
metadata.comment: Records of all transactions that have occurred on Cosmos, dating back to the genesis block. NOTE - FOR CHAIN VERSIONS 1-3 THE TX_FROM, FEE, AND FEE_DENOM COLUMNS ARE ALWAYS NULL. (This info may be available in the msgs column, but we are not parsing it out at this time.)

BLOCK_ID.name: BLOCK_ID
BLOCK_ID.comment: The block height the block was recorded at.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block began.

TX_ID.name: TX_ID
TX_ID.comment: A unique key that identifies a transaction. Called "TxHash" on block explorers.

TX_FROM.name: TX_FROM
TX_FROM.comment: The wallet address of the individual who initiated the transaction

TX_SUCCEEDED.name: TX_SUCCEEDED
TX_SUCCEEDED.comment: Transaction status is "TRUE" if the transaction went through, "FALSE" if the transaction failed.

FEE.name: FEE
FEE.comment: The fee is paid by the initiator of the transaction. Fee = gas * gas price.

FEE_DENOM.name: FEE_DENOM
FEE_DENOM.comment: The denominator of the transaction fee.

GAS_USED.name: GAS_USED
GAS_USED.comment: The amount of gas consumed by the transaction.

GAS_WANTED.name: GAS_WANTED
GAS_WANTED.comment: Amount of gas requested for a transaction. It is provided by users when the transaction is generated.

TX_CODE.name: TX_CODE
TX_CODE.comment: A number that corresponds to various error codes. When "0", the transaction is successful. Non-zero numbers signify different types of transaction failures.

TX_LOG.name: TX_LOG
TX_LOG.comment: A string that contains the transaction logs, which are logs written by the program interacted with during the transaction.

MSGS.name: MSGS
MSGS.comment: The underlying json from the messages or events within the transactions

UNIQUE_KEY.name: UNIQUE_KEY
UNIQUE_KEY.comment: The unique key for the table.

FACT_TRANSACTIONS_ID.name: FACT_TRANSACTIONS_ID
FACT_TRANSACTIONS_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: FACT_TRANSFERS
metadata.comment: Records of all transfers on Cosmos from chain version 4 and beyond. (This info may be available in the msgs column in core.fact_transactions, but we are not parsing it out at this time.)

BLOCK_ID.name: BLOCK_ID
BLOCK_ID.comment: The block height the block was recorded at.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block began.

TX_ID.name: TX_ID
TX_ID.comment: A unique key that identifies a transaction. Called "TxHash" on block explorers.

TX_SUCCEEDED.name: TX_SUCCEEDED
TX_SUCCEEDED.comment: Transaction status is "TRUE" if the transaction went through, "FALSE" if the transaction failed.

TRANSFER_TYPE.name: TRANSFER_TYPE
TRANSFER_TYPE.comment: Details on the type of transfer occurring during the transaction. "Transfer_In" = depositing tokens onto the Cosmos Hub. "Transfer_out" = withdrawing tokens from the Cosmos Hub. "Cosmos" = wallet to wallet transfer on the Cosmos Hub.

SENDER.name: SENDER
SENDER.comment: The wallet address of the individual sent tokens in the transfer.

AMOUNT.name: AMOUNT
AMOUNT.comment: The amount that was used in the transaction message.

CURRENCY.name: CURRENCY
CURRENCY.comment: The currency that was used in the transaction message.

RECEIVER.name: RECEIVER
RECEIVER.comment: The wallet address of the individual received tokens in the transfer.

UNIQUE_KEY.name: UNIQUE_KEY
UNIQUE_KEY.comment: The unique key for the table.

FACT_TRANSFERS_ID.name: FACT_TRANSFERS_ID
FACT_TRANSFERS_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

metadata.name: FACT_VALIDATORS
metadata.comment: A table that contains labels for and additional information about Cosmos Hub validators

ADDRESS.name: ADDRESS
ADDRESS.comment: Address unique to an individual wallet, validator, or token.

BLOCKCHAIN.name: BLOCKCHAIN
BLOCKCHAIN.comment: In this table, always Cosmos. Used to join to cross-chain tables.

CREATOR.name: CREATOR
CREATOR.comment: Name of the label creator - for now, this will always be "Flipside."

LABEL_TYPE.name: LABEL_TYPE
LABEL_TYPE.comment: A broad category that describes what a label is representing.

LABEL_SUBTYPE.name: LABEL_SUBTYPE
LABEL_SUBTYPE.comment: Adds more detail to the label type.

LABEL.name: LABEL
LABEL.comment: The label or name of the address.

PROJECT_NAME.name: PROJECT_NAME
PROJECT_NAME.comment: The name of the project the label belongs to.

ACCOUNT_ADDRESS.name: ACCOUNT_ADDRESS
ACCOUNT_ADDRESS.comment: The Cosmos address of the user / entity that operates the validator.

DELEGATOR_SHARES.name: DELEGATOR_SHARES
DELEGATOR_SHARES.comment: The number of tokens staked to the validator.

SELF_DELEGATION.name: SELF_DELEGATION
SELF_DELEGATION.comment: The number of ATOM tokens that the operator currently has staked with their own validator.

NUM_DELEGATORS.name: NUM_DELEGATORS
NUM_DELEGATORS.comment: The number of wallets that stake their ATOM tokens with the validator.

RATE.name: RATE
RATE.comment: The commission rate that the validator is currently charging.

MAX_CHANGE_RATE.name: MAX_CHANGE_RATE
MAX_CHANGE_RATE.comment: The maximum rate at which a validator can change their commission per day.

MAX_RATE.name: MAX_RATE
MAX_RATE.comment: The maximum commission rate that the validator can charge

COMMISSION_RATE_LAST_UPDATED.name: COMMISSION_RATE_LAST_UPDATED
COMMISSION_RATE_LAST_UPDATED.comment: The date of the last commission change.

STATUS.name: STATUS
STATUS.comment: Validators with a status of BOND_STATUS_BONDED are active and validators with a status of BOND_STATUS_UNBONDED are inactive.

JAILED.name: JAILED
JAILED.comment: FALSE when a validator is not jailed, TRUE when a validator is jailed

RANK.name: RANK
RANK.comment: The rank of the validator in the validator set. Rank is determined by the number of ATOM tokens staked to the validator

NUM_GOVERNANCE_VOTES.name: NUM_GOVERNANCE_VOTES
NUM_GOVERNANCE_VOTES.comment: The number of governance proposals the validator has voted on during its lifetime.

RAW_METADATA.name: RAW_METADATA
RAW_METADATA.comment: Additional details about the validator or token in json format.

UNIQUE_KEY.name: UNIQUE_KEY
UNIQUE_KEY.comment: The unique key of the table

FACT_VALIDATORS_ID.name: FACT_VALIDATORS_ID
FACT_VALIDATORS_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

VOTE_OPTION.comment: How the delegator voted on the proposal.

The `identifier` and `tx_hash` columns relate this table back to `fact_traces`, which contains more details on the transfers.

ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.comment: The function signature of this transaction.

metadata.comment: A convenience table that aggregates block and transaction related metrics using various aggregate functions such as SUM, COUNT, MIN and MAX from the fact_transactions table, on an hourly basis.

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_LIQUIDATIONS
metadata.comment: This table contains transactions in which a borrower's collateral asset is liquidated across AAVE, COMPOUND, MOONWELL, SEAMLESS, SONNE, and GRANARY protocols. Liquidations occur when a borrower's health factor goes below 1 due to their collateral value not properly covering their loan/debt value. This might happen when the collateral decreases in value or the borrowed debt increases in value against each other. This collateral vs loan value ratio is shown in the health factor. In a liquidation, up to 50% of a borrower's debt is repaid and that value + liquidation fee is taken from the collateral available, so after a liquidation the amount liquidated from one's debt is repaid.

metadata.name: EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY
metadata.comment: A convenience table that aggregates bridge activity from event_logs, traces and transfers, including bridge deposits and transfers sent from the following protocols: ACROSS, AXELAR, CELER, CBRIDGE, DLN, DEBRIDGE, HOP, MESON, STARGATE, SYMBIOSIS, SYNAPSE, WORMHOLE along with other helpful columns, including an amount USD where available. Note, this table only includes records for the protocols listed above with live, onchain bridge activity and may not represent the complete bridging picture.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block was produced.

ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The from address where the transaction originated from. This may be an EOA or contract address, however in most cases this is the user that initiated the bridge deposit or transfer.

ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.comment: The from address of this transaction.

ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.name: ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.comment: The function signature of this transaction.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.

BRIDGE_ADDRESS.name: BRIDGE_ADDRESS
BRIDGE_ADDRESS.comment: The address of the contract responsible for handling the bridge deposit or transfer. This contract mediates the transfer and ensures that assets are sent and received appropriately.

EVENT_NAME.name: EVENT_NAME
EVENT_NAME.comment: The decoded event name for a given event.

PLATFORM.name: PLATFORM
PLATFORM.comment: The platform or protocol from which the bridge transaction or event originates.

SENDER.name: SENDER
SENDER.comment: The address that initiated the bridge deposit or transfer. This address is the sender of the tokens/assets being bridged to the destination chain. This may be an EOA or contract address.

RECEIVER.name: RECEIVER
RECEIVER.comment: The designated address set to receive the deposit or transfer. This may be an EOA or contract address.

DESTINATION_CHAIN_RECEIVER.name: DESTINATION_CHAIN_RECEIVER
DESTINATION_CHAIN_RECEIVER.comment: The designated address set to receive the bridged tokens on the target chain after the completion of the bridge transaction. For non-evm chains, the hex address is decoded/encoded to match the data format of the destination chain, where possible. This may be an EOA or contract address.

DESTINATION_CHAIN.name: DESTINATION_CHAIN
DESTINATION_CHAIN.comment: The name of the blockchain network to which the assets are being bridged. It could be any EVM compatible chain or other blockchain networks that the bridging protocol supports.

DESTINATION_CHAIN_ID.name: DESTINATION_CHAIN_ID
DESTINATION_CHAIN_ID.comment: The numeric identifier associated with the destination blockchain network. This is specific to the chain and helps in uniquely identifying it.

TOKEN_ADDRESS.name: TOKEN_ADDRESS
TOKEN_ADDRESS.comment: The address associated with the token that is being bridged. It provides a unique identifier for the token within its origin blockchain.

TOKEN_SYMBOL.name: TOKEN_SYMBOL
TOKEN_SYMBOL.comment: The symbol representing the token being bridged. This provides a shorthand representation of the token.

AMOUNT_UNADJ.name: AMOUNT_UNADJ
AMOUNT_UNADJ.comment: The raw, non-decimal adjusted amount of tokens involved in the bridge transaction.

AMOUNT.name: AMOUNT
AMOUNT.comment: The decimal adjusted amount of tokens involved in the bridge transaction, where available.

AMOUNT_USD.name: AMOUNT_USD
AMOUNT_USD.comment: The value of the bridged tokens in USD at the time of the bridge transaction, where available.

EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID.name: EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID
EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

metadata.name: FACT_TRACES
metadata.comment: This table contains flattened trace data for internal contract calls on the Base Blockchain. Hex encoded fields can be decoded to integers by using `utils.udf_hex_to_int()`.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: The transaction hash for the trace. Please note, this is not necessarily unique in this table as transactions frequently have multiple traces.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: The block number of this transaction.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The block timestamp of this transaction.

FROM_ADDRESS.name: FROM_ADDRESS
FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The sending address of this trace. This is not necessarily the from address of the transaction.

TO_ADDRESS.name: TO_ADDRESS
TO_ADDRESS.comment: The receiving address of this trace. This is not necessarily the to address of the transaction.

VALUE.name: VALUE
VALUE.comment: The amount of ETH transferred in this trace.

VALUE_PRECISE_RAW.name: VALUE_PRECISE_RAW
VALUE_PRECISE_RAW.comment: The precise, unadjusted amount of the transaction. This is returned as a string to avoid precision loss.

VALUE_PRECISE.name: VALUE_PRECISE
VALUE_PRECISE.comment: The precise, adjusted amount of the transaction. This is returned as a string to avoid precision loss.

GAS.name: GAS
GAS.comment: The gas supplied for this trace.

GAS_USED.name: GAS_USED
GAS_USED.comment: The gas used for this trace.

INPUT.name: INPUT
INPUT.comment: The input data for this trace.

OUTPUT.name: OUTPUT
OUTPUT.comment: The output data for this trace.

TYPE.name: TYPE
TYPE.comment: The type of internal transaction. Common trace types are `CALL`, `DELEGATECALL`, and `STATICCALL`.

IDENTIFIER.name: IDENTIFIER
IDENTIFIER.comment: This field represents the position and type of the trace within the transaction.

DATA.name: DATA
DATA.comment: The raw JSON data for this trace.

SUB_TRACES.name: SUB_TRACES
SUB_TRACES.comment: The amount of nested sub traces for this trace.

TRACE_STATUS.name: TRACE_STATUS
TRACE_STATUS.comment: The status of the trace, either `SUCCESS` or `FAIL`

ERROR_REASON.name: ERROR_REASON
ERROR_REASON.comment: The reason for the trace failure, if any.

TRACE_INDEX.name: TRACE_INDEX
TRACE_INDEX.comment: The index of the trace within the transaction.

FACT_TRACES_ID.name: FACT_TRACES_ID
FACT_TRACES_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

metadata.name: EZ_DEX_SWAPS
metadata.comment:
This table currently contains swap events from the ```fact_event_logs``` table for  SUSHI, UNISWAP, BALANCER, SWAPBASED, BASESWAP, DACKIE, WOOFI, AERODROME, CURVE, MAVERICK, and VOODOO. along with other helpful columns including an amount USD where possible. Other dexes coming soon!
Note: A rule has been put in place to null out the amount_USD if that number is too divergent between amount_in_USD and amount_out_usd. This can happen for swaps of less liquid tokens during very high fluctuation of price.

EVENT_NAME.comment: The decoded event name for a given event.

AMOUNT_IN_USD.comment: The amount of tokens put into the swap converted to USD using the price of the token.

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_FLASHLOANS
metadata.comment: This table contains flash loan transactions across AAVE, SEAMLESS, and GRANARY protocols. Flash loans are a feature designed for developers, due to the technical knowledge required to execute one. Flash Loans allow you to borrow any available amount of assets without providing any collateral, as long as the liquidity is returned to the protocol within one block transaction.

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_DEPOSITS
metadata.comment: This table contains deposit transactions across AAVE, COMPOUND, MOONWELL, SEAMLESS, SONNE, and GRANARY protocols. A user deposits their preferred asset and amount. After depositing, users earn passive income based on the market borrowing demand. Additionally, depositing allows users to borrow by using their deposited assets as a collateral. Any interest earned by depositing funds helps offset the interest rate accumulated by borrowing.

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_REPAYMENTS
metadata.comment: This table contains transactions in which a borrower repays their loan (debt) across the AAVE, COMPOUND, MOONWELL, SEAMLESS, SONNE, and GRANARY protocols.  Loans are repaid in the same asset borrowed, plus accrued interest. Borrowers can pay back their loan based on the USD price as they can borrow any of the available stable coins (USDC, DAI, USDT, etc.).

metadata.name: EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY
metadata.comment: A convenience table that aggregates bridge activity from event_logs, traces and transfers, including bridge deposits and transfers sent from the following protocols: CELER, HOP, MESON along with other helpful columns, including an amount USD where available. Note, this table only includes records for the protocols listed above with live, onchain bridge activity and may not represent the complete bridging picture.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block was produced.

ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The from address where the transaction originated from. This may be an EOA or contract address, however in most cases this is the user that initiated the bridge deposit or transfer.

ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.comment: The from address of this transaction.

ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.name: ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.comment: The function signature of this transaction.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.

BRIDGE_ADDRESS.name: BRIDGE_ADDRESS
BRIDGE_ADDRESS.comment: The address of the contract responsible for handling the bridge deposit or transfer. This contract mediates the transfer and ensures that assets are sent and received appropriately.

EVENT_NAME.name: EVENT_NAME
EVENT_NAME.comment: The decoded event name for a given event.

PLATFORM.name: PLATFORM
PLATFORM.comment: The platform or protocol from which the bridge transaction or event originates.

SENDER.name: SENDER
SENDER.comment: The address that initiated the bridge deposit or transfer. This address is the sender of the tokens/assets being bridged to the destination chain. This may be an EOA or contract address.

RECEIVER.name: RECEIVER
RECEIVER.comment: The designated address set to receive the deposit or transfer. This may be an EOA or contract address.

DESTINATION_CHAIN_RECEIVER.name: DESTINATION_CHAIN_RECEIVER
DESTINATION_CHAIN_RECEIVER.comment: The designated address set to receive the bridged tokens on the target chain after the completion of the bridge transaction. For non-evm chains, the hex address is decoded/encoded to match the data format of the destination chain, where possible. This may be an EOA or contract address.

DESTINATION_CHAIN.name: DESTINATION_CHAIN
DESTINATION_CHAIN.comment: The name of the blockchain network to which the assets are being bridged. It could be any EVM compatible chain or other blockchain networks that the bridging protocol supports.

DESTINATION_CHAIN_ID.name: DESTINATION_CHAIN_ID
DESTINATION_CHAIN_ID.comment: The numeric identifier associated with the destination blockchain network. This is specific to the chain and helps in uniquely identifying it.

TOKEN_ADDRESS.name: TOKEN_ADDRESS
TOKEN_ADDRESS.comment: The address associated with the token that is being bridged. It provides a unique identifier for the token within its origin blockchain.

TOKEN_SYMBOL.name: TOKEN_SYMBOL
TOKEN_SYMBOL.comment: The symbol representing the token being bridged. This provides a shorthand representation of the token.

AMOUNT_UNADJ.name: AMOUNT_UNADJ
AMOUNT_UNADJ.comment: The raw, non-decimal adjusted amount of tokens involved in the bridge transaction.

AMOUNT.name: AMOUNT
AMOUNT.comment: The decimal adjusted amount of tokens involved in the bridge transaction, where available.

AMOUNT_USD.name: AMOUNT_USD
AMOUNT_USD.comment: The value of the bridged tokens in USD at the time of the bridge transaction, where available.

EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID.name: EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID
EZ_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_REPAYMENTS
metadata.comment: This table contains transactions in which a borrower repays their loan (debt) across the AAVE, REALT, SPARK, and AGAVE protocols.  Loans are repaid in the same asset borrowed, plus accrued interest. Borrowers can pay back their loan based on the USD price as they can borrow any of the available stable coins (USDC, DAI, USDT, etc.).

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_DEPOSITS
metadata.comment: This table contains deposit transactions across AAVE, REALT, SPARK, and AGAVE protocols. A user deposits their preferred asset and amount. After depositing, users earn passive income based on the market borrowing demand. Additionally, depositing allows users to borrow by using their deposited assets as a collateral. Any interest earned by depositing funds helps offset the interest rate accumulated by borrowing.

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_LIQUIDATIONS
metadata.comment: This table contains transactions in which a borrower's collateral asset is liquidated across AAVE, REALT, SPARK, and AGAVE protocols. Liquidations occur when a borrower's health factor goes below 1 due to their collateral value not properly covering their loan/debt value. This might happen when the collateral decreases in value or the borrowed debt increases in value against each other. This collateral vs loan value ratio is shown in the health factor. In a liquidation, up to 50% of a borrower's debt is repaid and that value + liquidation fee is taken from the collateral available, so after a liquidation the amount liquidated from one's debt is repaid.

metadata.name: EZ_LENDING_FLASHLOANS
metadata.comment: This table contains flash loan transactions across AAVE, SPARK, and AGAVE protocols. Flash loans are a feature designed for developers, due to the technical knowledge required to execute one. Flash Loans allow you to borrow any available amount of assets without providing any collateral, as long as the liquidity is returned to the protocol within one block transaction.

metadata.name: EZ_DEX_SWAPS
metadata.comment:
This table currently contains swap events from the ```fact_event_logs``` table for CURVE, BALANCER, SUSHI, HONEYSWAP, and SWAPR along with other helpful columns including an amount USD where possible. Other dexes coming soon! 
Note: A rule has been put in place to null out the amount_USD if that number is too divergent between amount_in_usd and amount_out_usd. This can happen for swaps of less liquid tokens during very high fluctuation of price.

metadata.name: FACT_MSG_ATTRIBUTES
metadata.comment: Records of all message attributes associated to messages that have occurred on Sei, dating back to the genesis block.

BLOCK_ID.name: BLOCK_ID
BLOCK_ID.comment: The block height the block was recorded at.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block began.

TX_ID.name: TX_ID
TX_ID.comment: A unique key that identifies a transaction. Called "TxHash" on block explorers.

TX_SUCCEEDED.name: TX_SUCCEEDED
TX_SUCCEEDED.comment: Transaction status is TRUE if the transaction was successful, FALSE if the transaction failed.

MSG_GROUP.name: MSG_GROUP
MSG_GROUP.comment: Value grouping different messages together to represent a single action. Format will include the numeric msg_group and msg_sub_group with a ":" seperator. The subgroup will always be 0 except for "Exec" actions. NULL group means messages are related to the header (overall transaction)

MSG_INDEX.name: MSG_INDEX
MSG_INDEX.comment: Short for "message index," the position in which messages occur in a transaction.

MSG_TYPE.name: MSG_TYPE
MSG_TYPE.comment: A string containing information about the type of message occurring.

ATTRIBUTE_KEY.name: ATTRIBUTE_KEY
ATTRIBUTE_KEY.comment: They key from the key-value pair from the message attribute

ATTRIBUTE_VALUE.name: ATTRIBUTE_VALUE
ATTRIBUTE_VALUE.comment: They value from the key-value pair from the message attribute

FACT_MSG_ATTRIBUTES_ID.name: FACT_MSG_ATTRIBUTES_ID
FACT_MSG_ATTRIBUTES_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: EZ_NATIVE_TRANSFERS
metadata.comment: This table contains a flattened easy version of the native transfers. This table uses the fact_transfers table as a base and filters down to only aptos tokens. The logic used to derive this table requires the withdrawal event to occur in the previous event to the deposit event and also requires the withdrawal event to be the same amount as the deposit event. The only exception to that rule is when a "CoinRegisterEvent" occurs in between the withdraw and deposit events. Any transfers that do not meet this criteria are not included in this table.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block was produced.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed.

VERSION.name: VERSION
VERSION.comment: The version also know as the height of the transactions that have been executed on the Aptos blockchain. The first transaction in the blockchain has a version of 0. The version number is incremented by 1 for each transaction that is executed on the blockchain.

SUCCESS.name: SUCCESS
SUCCESS.comment: The boolean value indicating whether the transaction was successful or not.

FROM_ADDRESS.name: FROM_ADDRESS
FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The account address that sent the transfer.

TO_ADDRESS.name: TO_ADDRESS
TO_ADDRESS.comment: The account address that received the transfer.

AMOUNT.name: AMOUNT
AMOUNT.comment: The non-decimal adjusted amount of a token. For example, if a token has 18 decimals, then the amount of 1 token is 10^18.

TOKEN_ADDRESS.name: TOKEN_ADDRESS
TOKEN_ADDRESS.comment: The full address of the token. This string contains the account,module, and resource.

EZ_NATIVE_TRANSFERS_ID.name: EZ_NATIVE_TRANSFERS_ID
EZ_NATIVE_TRANSFERS_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: FACT_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY
metadata.comment: A fact table that aggregates bridge activity for bridge deposits and transfers sent from the following protocols: CELER, LAYER ZERO, MOVER, and WORMHOLE. Note, this table only includes records for the protocols listed above with live, onchain bridge activity and may not represent the complete bridging picture.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block was produced.

VERSION.name: VERSION
VERSION.comment: The version also know as the height of the transactions that have been executed on the Aptos blockchain. The first transaction in the blockchain has a version of 0. The version number is incremented by 1 for each transaction that is executed on the blockchain.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed.

PLATFORM.name: PLATFORM
PLATFORM.comment: The platform or protocol from which the bridge transaction or event originates.

BRIDGE_ADDRESS.name: BRIDGE_ADDRESS
BRIDGE_ADDRESS.comment: The address of the contract responsible for handling the bridge deposit or transfer. This contract mediates the transfer and ensures that assets are sent and received appropriately.

EVENT_NAME.name: EVENT_NAME
EVENT_NAME.comment: The third segment of the event type

TX_SENDER.name: TX_SENDER
TX_SENDER.comment: Sender is the address of the originator account for a transaction. A transaction must be signed by the originator.

SENDER.name: SENDER
SENDER.comment: The address that initiated the bridge deposit or transfer. This address is the sender of the tokens/assets being bridged to the destination chain.

RECEIVER.name: RECEIVER
RECEIVER.comment: The designated address set to receive the bridged tokens on the target chain after the completion of the bridge transaction. For non-evm chains, the hex address is decoded/encoded to match the data format of the destination chain, where possible.

SOURCE_CHAIN_ID.name: SOURCE_CHAIN_ID
SOURCE_CHAIN_ID.comment: The numeric identifier associated with the source blockchain network. This is specific to the chain and helps in uniquely identifying it.

DESTINATION_CHAIN_ID.name: DESTINATION_CHAIN_ID
DESTINATION_CHAIN_ID.comment: The numeric identifier associated with the destination blockchain network. This is specific to the chain and helps in uniquely identifying it.

TOKEN_ADDRESS.name: TOKEN_ADDRESS
TOKEN_ADDRESS.comment: The address associated with the token that is being bridged. It provides a unique identifier for the token within its origin blockchain.

AMOUNT_UNADJ.name: AMOUNT_UNADJ
AMOUNT_UNADJ.comment: The non-decimal adjusted amount of a token. For example, if a token has 18 decimals, then the amount of 1 token is 10^18.

FACT_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID.name: FACT_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID
FACT_BRIDGE_ACTIVITY_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: FACT_TRANSFERS
metadata.comment: This table contains Deposit and Withdraw events on the aptos blockchain.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block was produced.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed.

VERSION.name: VERSION
VERSION.comment: The version also know as the height of the transactions that have been executed on the Aptos blockchain. The first transaction in the blockchain has a version of 0. The version number is incremented by 1 for each transaction that is executed on the blockchain.

SUCCESS.name: SUCCESS
SUCCESS.comment: The boolean value indicating whether the transaction was successful or not.

EVENT_INDEX.name: EVENT_INDEX
EVENT_INDEX.comment: Unique identifier for the event. This is a monotonically increasing integer that is incremented for each event. This is useful for determining the order of changes.

CREATION_NUMBER.name: CREATION_NUMBER
CREATION_NUMBER.comment: Ceation number corresponding to the event stream originating from the given account.

TRANSFER_EVENT.name: TRANSFER_EVENT
TRANSFER_EVENT.comment: The type of transfer event. Value will either be  'WithdrawEvent' or 'DepositEvent'

ACCOUNT_ADDRESS.name: ACCOUNT_ADDRESS
ACCOUNT_ADDRESS.comment: The top level address for this event.

AMOUNT.name: AMOUNT
AMOUNT.comment: The non-decimal adjusted amount of a token. For example, if a token has 18 decimals, then the amount of 1 token is 10^18.

TOKEN_ADDRESS.name: TOKEN_ADDRESS
TOKEN_ADDRESS.comment: The full address of the token. This string contains the account,module, and resource.

FACT_TRANSFERS_ID.name: FACT_TRANSFERS_ID
FACT_TRANSFERS_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.name: MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP
MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

metadata.name: FACT_EVENT_LOGS
metadata.comment: This table contains flattened event logs from transactions on the Ethereum Blockchain. Transactions may have multiple events, which are denoted by the event index for a transaction hash. Therefore, this table is unique on the combination of transaction hash and event index. Please see `fact_decoded_event_logs` or `ez_decoded_event_logs` for the decoded event logs.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block was produced.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.

ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.name: ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.comment: The function signature of this transaction.

ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The from address at the transaction level.

ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.comment: The to address at the transaction level.

CONTRACT_ADDRESS.name: CONTRACT_ADDRESS
CONTRACT_ADDRESS.comment: The address interacted with for a given event.

EVENT_REMOVED.name: EVENT_REMOVED
EVENT_REMOVED.comment: Whether the event has been removed from the transaction.

_LOG_ID.name: _LOG_ID
_LOG_ID.comment: Deprecated. This column is no longer used. Please remove from your query by Jan. 10 2024.'

FACT_EVENT_LOGS_ID.name: FACT_EVENT_LOGS_ID
FACT_EVENT_LOGS_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.name: INSERTED_TIMESTAMP
INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.

MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was last modified.

metadata.name: EZ_DECODED_EVENT_LOGS
metadata.comment:
'For information on how to submit a contract for decoding, as well as how ABIs are sourced, please visit [here](https://science.flipsidecrypto.xyz/abi-requestor/). This model contains decoded event logs for contracts that we have an ABI for. Please note, this table does not include all event logs, only those that we have an ABI for. The `decoded_log` column is the easiest place to query decoded data. It is a JSON object, where the keys are the names of the event parameters, and the values are the values of the event parameters. You can select from this column using the following sample format, `decoded_log:from::string` or more generally, `decoded_log:<event_param>::datatype`. See below for a full sample query. The `full_decoded_logs` column contains the same information, as well as additional fields such as the datatype of the decoded data. You may need to laterally flatten this column to query the data.
      
Sample query for USDC Transfer events:
```sql select  tx_hash, block_number, contract_address, decoded_log:from::string as from_address, decoded_log:to::string as to_address, decoded_log:value::integer as value from ethereum.core.fact_decoded_event_logs where contract_address = lower('0xA0b86991c6218b36c1d19D4a2e9Eb0cE3606eB48') and block_number between 16400000 and 16405000 and event_name = 'Transfer' limit 50```'

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block was produced.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.

CONTRACT_ADDRESS.name: CONTRACT_ADDRESS
CONTRACT_ADDRESS.comment: The address interacted with for a given event.

CONTRACT_NAME.name: CONTRACT_NAME
CONTRACT_NAME.comment: The name of the contract, if the contract has a name() function.

EVENT_NAME.name: EVENT_NAME
EVENT_NAME.comment: The name of the event, as defined in the contract ABI.

DECODED_LOG.name: DECODED_LOG
DECODED_LOG.comment: The flattened decoded log, where the keys are the names of the event parameters, and the values are the values of the event parameters.

FULL_DECODED_LOG.name: FULL_DECODED_LOG
FULL_DECODED_LOG.comment: The full decoded log, including the event name, the event parameters, and the data type of the event parameters.

ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.name: ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.comment: The function signature of this transaction.

ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The from address at the transaction level.

ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.comment: The to address at the transaction level.

EVENT_REMOVED.name: EVENT_REMOVED
EVENT_REMOVED.comment: Whether the event has been removed from the transaction.

EZ_DECODED_EVENT_LOGS_ID.name: EZ_DECODED_EVENT_LOGS_ID
EZ_DECODED_EVENT_LOGS_ID.comment: The unique identifier for each row in the table.

INSERTED_TIMESTAMP.comment: The utc timestamp at which the row was inserted into the table.
